It did not overpower the egg, and the slow onset of the spice really helped to enhance the flavor of the egg and really synergized with the pickling. The specials for the night were tacos, pulled pork, roast chicken, and fried tilapia and I order one of each.  The tilapia was superb--really, I think the Old Fashioned has deep frying perfected.  The chicken was tasty, but was overpowered by the salsa roja; the pork, on the other hand, was dry and did not have enough salsa to cover up the dryness.  However, for the price of $1.50 per taco, I was well-satisfied. In terms of drinks, the Moon Man I had was delicious--a tinge of fruitiness and a little bitter counterpoint made for a very refreshing drink that helped to lighten the rich cheese curds.  I of course also had to try the namesake drink, a brandy Old Fashioned, which was as delicious as it looked.  The mashed up orange in addition to an orange slice garnish really helped to accent the brandy.  The Old Fashioned is definitely worth a visit, no matter who you are.  I have heard that their burgers are where they truly excel and I am eager to try them.  With very reasonable prices, especially for such tasty food, I have a feeling that this is place I will return to often.
Service was timely, food was excellent. #35 sandwich and cheese curds with Tiger sauce is highly recommendable

A great Wisconsin restaurant.  Tons of local brews and great local fare make this a must visit.  Great fish fry, and a really cool atmosphere in the heart of Madison.  Offers good selection of beer, and some great local foods.

Admittedly we came here on a relativity busy night. When we arrived, we were told it would take 45min-1hr to seat us, wound up taking a full 2:15 hours (wtf?). We asked three times to make sure we hadn't been skipped, even though a party of four that arrived after us was finishing their food as we sat down. Once we finally sat, the host put us at the wrong table and asked us to move. Twenty minutes later our waiter showed up to take our food order. This was lackluster service to the max. Everyone apologized, but did nothing to make it any better. Having been a cook, I hate to review based on poor hosts and unresponsive wait staff alone.  Enough about the service, I came here based on the Yelp reviews for the food and beer. The prices for food are really cheap, and the quality of the meals are a marginal degree more worthy than the price of the food (if the prices are 'cheap' the food is 'not bad'). It was OK for a $9 plate of Mac and cheese, and the cheese plate had pretty good options on it. The food came out extremely fast relative to the rest of our experience here. All in all, it's alright in that regard, nothing to get too sweaty and excited about, definitely not worth 2 hours.  The beer selection is pretty solid, and I had a few glasses of beer which were fairly pleasing. The bar tender was really nice and very helpful in selecting brews while we waited for a table. She's the reason I didn't leave 1 star.  All in all the speed of the cooks and the decent beer kept this from being a total waste of time, but it was really, really close to being a waste of our entire evening. Would have rather just gone to a sandwich shop.
Excellent food in very generous portions plus stellar service!! I crave their chicken and biscuits! Love the atmosphere and the views of Capitol Square. The drink menu is very respectable.

They get 5 stars for their cheese curds and beer list alone!   We went on some what of a curd crawl and their's definitely stole the show! They had a perfect crust, a gooey center, and a dip sauce that didn't remind you that they are really just glorified mozzarella sticks, like marinara sauce.   They're beer list was praise worthy! It was really hard not to get an old fashioned like the rest of my group but the beer list had too many good looking sours, which happen to be one of my favorite styles! I settled my sour fix with Dave's Funk IV. I did try a taste of an old fashioned and loved the use of brandy in it.   We also tried the lazy Susan because it sounded different but after a night of drinking and curds, the pickled herring, eggs, and liverwurst were probably not the best mix!   I only wish I could have taken this bar home with me! So many beers I still wanted to try and cheese curds to later binge on!

Call me boring, but I love the No. 37. Just a chicken sandwich, but a GOOD chicken sandwich. Perfectly cooked, wonderfully tender chicken on yummy bread. I made a few modifications, swapping the swiss cheese with cheddar and nixing the mustard, but it was still delish. Also love their haystacks and ALL of the dips. Have also had good service every time I've visited.
Best cheese curds in town! The rest of the menu is lack luster, IMO. Great place for an Old Fashioned, and some curds.
Been here a few times and it has always been good! Would not recommend the chicken tacos (special on taco tuesday) very spicy and dry.

I was in town for a concert so I thought I'd give a local staple a try, but in the end I really had no clue why this place has such high ratings.   The service was decent but still somewhat aloof.  Now, onto the food. If all I said was that it was disappointing that would be an understatement, this was some of the most bland food I've ever had. I ordered the "spicy" burger, I'm using quotations because I don't consider just throwing some jalapeos on a regular burger making it "spicy". The fries were boring and below average, they reminded me of the kind you buy frozen at a grocery store. I tried some of my friend's mac and cheese and it was decent but I wasn't blown away. This is Wisconsin for Christ's sake, you guys make the best cheese in the country and this mac and cheese was barely better than Stouffers.   I will relent they do live up to their name and make a great Old Fashioned, but that alone was not enough to redeem this dining experience.
It has a great atmosphere. When we were there last two times, most tables were full. It seemed like a happy place, especially around 5-8 pm. Food is good. Service is immaculate. The prices are right.

Nowhere around the square is more Wisconsin than the old fashioned. When it is available, I've gotten the heirloom tomato BLT for lunch and dinner are more occasions than I would like to admit. The Wisconsin Benedict might be my favorite brunch meal in existence; especially when paired up with the Wisconsin bloody mary to start. Be warned though, brunch ends at noon on the weekends.

I read the 2/26 review posted by Jessie H. with interest, as on several occasions my family and I have experienced rude service from a female bartender at the back bar of The Old Fashioned.  I wonder if this is the same person who assaulted your friend??   It is too bad that one employee an be allowed to repeatedly ruin the experience of many.  We too will not be coming back until something is done about the service.

I really love the Old Fashioned!  They have my favorite burger in town with their signature burger. Bacon cheeseburger with an egg on top!  This place knows how to proper cook this type of burger and the key is how the egg is cooked!  The have it down perfect!  Also a great atmosphere, although a little loud when it is fully packed!  Highly recommend!

Incredible selection of Wisconsin (only?) beers. I tried Bedlam by Ale Asylum, at the bartender's recommendation, and was not disappointed. The fried cheese curds were worth getting but I could feel my arteries clogging as I ate them. I got the house burger, which comes with a fried egg on top, and was really good. I gave 4 instead of 5 stars only because the beef was merely above-average and the bread a bit crumbly.
We are Madison residents and this is our favorite restaurant in town.  It has a great balance of menu items, drinks, food quality, service, and prices.
AMAZING cheese curds and a great beer selection. A definate staple in Madison!

My husband and I stopped in for a late lunch on our long drive from Louisville, KY back home to Fargo.  All I can say is YUM!!  He is a fan of Shinerbock but tried the house Huber Bock and really liked it. I'm a bourbon barrel stout girl and tried the pumpkin spice bourbon barrel stout. Not a fan. Not because it wasn't presented well, I just didn't expect such a strong citrus flavor.   Husband ordered the house burger and was excited to find they serve an excellent dusseldorf mustard. He said the burger was very good but I'm thinking it could have been terrible and he'd have said he liked it because of the mustard!  I chose the roasted eggplant, Portobello , etc. sandwich and I have to say it's one of the better veggie sandwiches I've ever eaten. I could only get through half of it and it was still tasty the next day when I reheated it in a skillet at home!  We both had cheese curds on the side of our sandwiches and needless to say, they were fantastic!  Good service, great atmosphere and food at a decent price. Definitely recommend.

This is the perfect place to get acquainted with Wisconsin's pride: Beer and Cheese.  Their tap selection is nearly intimidating for a non-local that's just diving into the wide array of charmingly named microbrews. My husband and I each had a flight of four snits and each one was more delicious than the last.  But what nearly had me making inappropriate noises in my seat was the Mac and Cheese. I wondered, "How good can a NINE dollar Mac and Cheese be?" I think I would have paid nineteen dollars for it...the creamy, buttery crunchy topped dish was incomparable.
One of the best stops in Madison for a burger, beer, and cheese curds. Wait can get long at times, but this place is a gem for anyone traveling or just wants some classic Wisconsin grub.

Best cheese curds of my life. Same goes for beer cheese soup. Basically, if you're into cheese, run don't walk to this restaurant.  Things to note: -Fairly large portion sizes, so keep that in mind when you order.  -Cheese curds -They have gluten-free bread, and 3 choices of it at that! -Prices are amazing. We had a FILLING meal for 4 people for under 70 bucks. -Did I mention cheese curds?
Overrated on the square. Good if you want something deep fried down. Huge portions for brunch.

I've been to the Old Fashioned a bunch of times. The food is good, the beer selection is awesome, and it's a fun, lively place. But my last visit really sealed the deal for me. I ordered a dish at lunch that they only have on the dinner menu. They mistakenly charged me for and gave me the kids' version. When I told the server, they instantly took care of replacing the dish with what I had wanted, and would not allow me to pay the difference between the two. All done with total grace and courtesy.  There are a lot of places with good food, but the Old Fashioned adds in exemplary service. We'll be back. (Even though there are STILL long waits for tables, even after their expansion!)

Third time may be the charm.  The last two visits were a disaster - 30 minute wait for my food or my meal was served uncooked.  The staff is friendly and apologetic but management don't listen.  Good luck!

We stopped in here for a late lunch after touring the Capitol.  They had a 51 beers on tap (!!) and close to 100 in bottles.  We tried a local beer and ordered some grub.  The food (salad for me), was fine but nothing special.  The location of the restaurant and all the beers on tap (along with the ambience) definitely makes up for the food.

This was my first visit to Old Fashioned.  The food was very good.  I had a chicken sandwich with dijon mustard, swiss cheese, and smoked bacon.  It comes with a side, I picked the salad, which had an awesome dressing.  We also got the cheese curds, which I highly recommend.  It was very busy, and the service was great regardless.

Really nice selection of local beers. The special was a very good deal, and the chosen beer (a seasonal New Glarus when I was there) was very good. The cheese curds were, as everyone says, really tasty and it was nice to have the choice of some interesting sauces. My meat eating companions assured me the burgers were really good. Got the eggplant and portobello sandwich which was nice, but not particularly special and I would probably not get it again. But I'll definitely be back for beer and cheese.
Overrated is the first word that comes to mind here. Often crowded, very few vegetarian/vegan options and a hit-or-miss wait staff. The major pro here: showcasing local, Wisconsin ingredients!
Pretty casual bar-type place, with really good bar food.

We come quite a bit for lunch.  Friendly service....very good "comfort" food.  The chili and walleye are pretty friggin' good.....so are the Bloody Mary's.  I don't think we've ever had anything that sucked there.  Highly recommended.
One of my favorite spots in Madison. Delicious drinks and favors locally sourced foods. Would highly recommend to both locals and visitors!
Sweet spot for beer lovers. Brats good too & bartenders very friendly & knowledgable.
Loud and crowded place. We waited for almost two hours in the chilling Madison wind and finally got a table by the door. The food is simply amazing. One star down for the waiting time.

The cheese curds are one of the best you'll find in the entire state.  Burger with fried is egg is messy but PHENOMENAL!  Fries are also excellent.  Would get 5 stars instead of 4 except service can be iffy at times and if you get a table near the door (in winter) it is cold and drafty.  Be prepared to wait if you go during lunch or dinner.

Excellent bang for you buck! Good pub style food. Great beer selection. Loved the atmosphere. Perfect place to meet up with a few friends on a weeknight and eat good food and have drinks on a cold wintery evening. The food was great and definitely comforting on a snowy day. Loved it. There are gluten free options as well!

We watched many an old fashioned being concocted as we sat at the bar in this establishment.  Upon walking in, we were told there would be about a 40 minute wait.  It was a Saturday evening, and, as there were many beers worth trying on the menu, we were fine with the wait.  A few minutes after we stood near the bar area, a set of seats opened up that could accommodate the four of us.  The bartender (Curt?) informed us that he was a "big deal" after one of us expressed concern that we should stick with the first bartender who tried to wait on us before we had decided upon what to order.  This bartender, who could tell we were knowledgeable about beer (after all, the beer list was what attracted us to this restaurant in the first place) offered many samples to help us make our selections.  If we asked for one sample, he often returned with two.  More than one of us ended up picking something he had recommended.  My favorite, by far, was the mudpuppy porter with ice cream.  If we had been hungry for dessert at the end of our meal, I would have just ordered that.  It was absolutely delicious.  As for the dining experience, when our buzzer alerted us to the fact that we'd have to leave the bar to be seated, we decided to just stay at the bar to eat instead.   One member of our group ordered a lazy Susan.  It was way more than one person could eat, but filled with delicious munchies.  Two people had burgers, one of them the Old Fashioned burger with the fried egg.  Both of those people enjoyed their selections.  I had the summer sausage sandwich.  While I did enjoy it and would order it again, I expected the sausage to be cut thicker.  It was also heated, which I did not expect.  The fries were thin and delicious as well.  If I visit Madison again, I'd definitely come back.  The location on the square is convenient, service was excellent, and I thoroughly enjoyed the evening.

Best place in Madison if you eat there once a month. Not so great if you eat there every day.  Drinks are beyond amazing and priced beautifully in the Wisconsin fashion. Waitstaff is plentiful. Atmosphere is perfect.  Everything has cheese in it, and I mean it. I will go there for the rest of my life.

I've never had a bad experience at the Old Fashioned! The cheese curds are the best in Madison, and the dips they come with are delicious! The restaurant is quite busy at dinner time, but it's the perfect location for an afternoon lunch or late night drink. Also, karaoke!

Many of the ones that I mention The Old Fashioned to always commented "very Wisconsin."  Well, I don't know exactly what that meant, but I was most impressed by the cheeses.  The Cheese Curd was really good.  We also had a platter with 3 different types of cheeses.  One was cheddar; the other one had a beer flavor; I forgot the other one, but they were all very good!  If great cheese is what is meant by "very Wisconsin," then I am all for it!

I had my first certified grass fed beef burger here and I must say it does taste different though I would not say it tastes better, just different. I have sampled the old fashioned burger and cheese curds with varying dipping sauces. The food was good. Hefty portions. This is definitely one of the better burger joints in town.  The place itself is a pretty small establishment so they really pack everyone so its not the best place to bring many children at the heavier trafficked times of the day but don't let that deter you. Just wanted to give you a heads up.

I love The Old Fashioned! The fried cheese curds are probably my favorite in the entire city of Madison. The drinks are really great and I love the environment. I've been coming to The Old Fashioned for 8 years now and it never gets old.
The food there is excellent and not expensive. The only down side is that we have to wait for one hour and half in a thursday night...Hope things can get better after their expansion work.

Excellent beer selection (all Wisconsin breweries).  Had an amber ale that really hit the spot.  Stopped in for lunch, so all I  looked at was the sandwich menu, and it all looked great.  Good prices too.  Most under $9.  I was in the mood for something light, so I got the grilled vegetable sandwich (okay, I admit it).  It was very good, except the eggplant skin was too tough to bite through, so I had to take it out and cut it up with a knife.  Still I would recommend this place. Nice atmosphere and friendly staff.  View of the capital building (site of all the political protests recently about teachers collective bargaining rights being stripped).  Still a lot of signs up of people supporting the teachers.

I loved the energetic atmosphere but the food was just ok.  The thin fries are out of a freezer bag and taste accordingly like any fast food fries.  The salad was generous and nice.  The turkey sandwich was mediocre, large but no pizzazz, it seemed just turkey and cheese, no avocado, nothing fresh, no bacon, truly old fashioned but not in a good way.  I would compare it to a Denny's.

I resisted going to The Old Fashioned because every person I met in Madison (I'm new here) had asked me if I had been yet and I hate things like that. I finally caved in for date night about 2 weeks ago and now I get it. We arrived at 6 pm on a Wednesday and got THE LAST TABLE open... at 6 PM. ON A WEDNESDAY. Amazing. Once I sat down and had impeccable service with even more comforting & delicious food, it all made sense. The house salad dressing is out of this world good and the fish fry was delicious. Crispy, fresh, and homemade without a hint of fishy-ness. The coleslaw was crisp and not gross. My boyfriend's burger was cooked perfectly to his liking. My only regret was that we didn't save room for dessert, and next time we will surely split an entree so that we do.

The Old Fashioned is definitely a popular restaurant with what seems like a constant flow of people. We visited on a Thursday night for a late dinner (around 8:30) and still had an hour wait in front of us because of how busy the place was! But, the restaurant was highly recommended by several friends as a place to get good, traditional Wisconsin food so we decided to wait it out.   When we were seated, the staff was attentive and nice.  We shared a cheese plate as an appetizer and I ordered No. 36, a beer battered walleye sandwich, as my entree. The cheese plate was unique and a good sampler of four local cheeses. On the other hand, my fish sandwich lacked flavor and salt. My co-workers ordered the Old Fashioned House Burger and No. 56, the Thursday Night Special (a HUGE portion of food). Both seemed satisfied with their meals. Overall, good food but nothing amazing.   Also, if you are vegetarian, be warned that there are very few options available here for you!
Been twice for lunch. Always busy , but has great food and speedy service!

We stopped by late morning one Saturday for a bloody mary, having read they have one  of the best in town.  The place was pretty busy - lots of people crowding tables for breakfast, but we were able to find a spot at the bar.  We ended up waiting about 10 minutes before we were noticed.  Strike one.  The bloody mary itself was the absolute worst I've ever had.  I fully admit I'm not a fan of horseradish, but I can handle it in moderation.  The Old Fashioned bloody, however, was just teeming with it.  That wouldn't have been the end of the world, except that the mix had only the slightest hint of tomoato flavor.  Overall, the drink tasted like water and horseradish.  Gross.  I pushed the drink aside, as there was no way I was going to drink it.  The bartender came back about 20 minutes later.  She asked if we were done, and I said yes.  She then took the completely full drink away without saying a world.  Wouldn't you think to maybe ask if something was wrong with it?  Yeah, I would too.  She dropped off the check, we paid, left, and will never return.  Yes, I should have said something about how terrible the bloody mary was, but I also believe that any halfway experienced bartender would also know to ask when a patron is obviously not pleased with a drink.  I'm sure this is a great place for breakfast, and I've had good beer & reasonably good food her in the past.  But if it's a bloody mary you want, please take my advice and go elsewhere.  Unless you really, really love horseradish & water.

Love it! Whenever we have visitors from out of town, we take them here. Love the beer cheese soup and the cheese curds! Also their burgers are delicious. If someone is looking for a good "Wisconsin" eating experience, The Old Fashioned does not disappoint...

I love this place for brunch, but am not very impressed with their dinner menu.. They only have a few entrees and the rest is mostly sandwiches, which isn't ideal for dinner. They have really great cheese curds though.   DO NOT get the chili, it is absolutely disgusting and basically just meat sauce/sloppy joe. Very disappointing.. And it was served cold.

This was my first visit to Wisconsin. The cheese platter did not disappoint. Definitely served Midwestern style with store bought cheap crackers, but then again, it is a cheese platter and the cheese was awesome.   I also ordered the house burger. It was delicious.  Great place to go with friends. Very upbeat and fun atmosphere.
Probably my favorite restaurant to grab a beer and a sandwich. Everything I've ever tried has been stellar. The beer list is the best in Madison. It is a must-bring to everyone that comes to visit.

The Old Fashioned a t le lieu de notre premier repas au US. La barre a tout de suite t place trs haut pour les hamburgers.  Le restaurant est frquent par un clientle d'habitue, des tudiants ( Madison c'est le moisns) et autres. C'est grand et plutt chaleureux. Le service est gentil et prvenant. Et les hamburgers sont trs bons ainsi que les cheese curds  (cheddar frit) et le choix de bires parfait. Bien sr tout est trs copieux ! Execellente adresse

Best beer selection on the square and amazingly affordable for the location.  Any person new to the Madison area needs to add this place to their "places to go" list.  Keep in mind, you have to order an old fashioned at the Old Fashioned.  When they ask, you want it brandy and sweet.

Came for a late lunch and left extremely happy. The cheese curds with tiger sauce were the best I've ever had. I loved the New England clam chowder, which I normally don't care for. The Old Fashioned burger is something I wish I could bring back home. It was perfectly seasoned, and the complement of the garlic sauce and yolk of the soft egg made me fall in love with this burger. A seat next to the window also provides an amazing view of the Capitol building.
Hey hey whadda say, it's a great place for a drink today!
I was there friday night, it was packed and amazing. Environment was very nice, bar tender was very nice. Best cheese curds ever, never had a burgur like this, fresh and juicy.

Dined here Saturday, February 11th and the cheese curds were excellent, sandwich was great and they offer an impressive beer selection.   However, we were seated next to 4 intoxicated 'adults' that chose to throw food at each other as well as other tables. They were loud, rude, confrontational and oblivious to the scene they were causing with their childish behavior. Once their drinks were cut off at the bar they became even more combative and belligerent. I can't give enough credit to the manager and wait staff as to how they handled the situation. They went above and beyond to be nice to these deplorable delinquents while also apologizing to nearby patrons for the disruption.   The confrontation lasted over 30 minutes and ruined the atmosphere and experience for everyone within 15 feet of these gross people. The courteous, calm staff set an example of basic human decency that the children of these patrons will never experience.

One of my favorite restaurants in the Midwest.  Always make it a point to visit whenever I'm in Madison. And, like most excellent restaurants, there is often and almost always a wait.  It's just great comfort food and hands down the best deep fried cheese curds I've had.  Here, too, I've brought many a coworker and customer and everyone has been a fan.  All the food has been decent from the salads to the burgers, brats, BBQ pork and turkey sandwiches to the tuna salad and fish.  Nothing that blew me away, but all good and all consistent.  My favorite part of the place is the bar. Just a really cool, old school/antique bar that runs 30 feet or so towards the back of the place.  An amazing beer selection as well as an outstanding selection of very original "WI foods" like beef jerky and pickled eggs.   Great location as well with a view of the Capitol building across the street along with being in the middle of a bustling area of other restaurants and bars.

LOVE their breakfast scrambles, potatoes and grapefruit old fashioned, especially after meandering the farmer's market. Service is generally fast even though they are usually busy. The noise level can be sometimes high however, the food is well worth the small annoyance.
The old Fashion is a great local burger and bar place with a great ambience and atmosphere to all!! The service is great and friendly! The food is good with many local Wisconsin options!

This is my favorite restaurant in Madison, by far. Go early to be sure you can get a table; if you try getting in at prime time on a Friday or Saturday, you're SOL. But once you're in, you're definitely in for a treat. They have the best cheese curds in town, hands down. For an entree, you can't go wrong with a burger, salmon salad or the mac and cheese.
Love this place!  The warm mini donuts, mimosas and bloody mary's are delicious for breakfast/brunch.
Beer battered walleye sandwich and deep fried cheese curds were excellent! Tons of local beers on tap. Bar service was great as well. Will be back again on my next stop in Madison.

This place is fabulous :)  On a weekend trip to Madison with some girlfriends, we stopped at this place. Three separate times, actually.  Highlights: beer cheese soup (we actually used it as dip for the french fries, SO GOOD), fried cheese curds (manna from cow heaven), and $9 pitchers of New Glarus. (coming from the NY/NJ area, this was reverse sticker shock for me)  Bartenders are extremely efficient and friendly, wait service is great. There can be a long wait on the weekend, but it's worth it! Great hangout!
Fun, signature Madison restaurant. Prices are very reasonable too for the Wisconsin sized portion.

The Old Fashioned is of the most delightful restaurants in Madison.  A 'Sconnie-style restaurant?  You got it here.  What you'll find here is tasty food that'll probably clog your arteries--but well, who cares!  Because the food at The Old Fashioned is so good, that eating healthy will be the last thing on your mind.  Everything served is local--from their cheeses, sausages, meat, and beer.  I will admit that things have changed a bit since they first opened (the No. 30 Hamburger is a bit smaller than I remembered), but I will still keep coming back to this place.

Overall, the food here was okay; it wasn't bad but it wasn't great either. The cheese curds were good although they were pretty greasy and salty. The bread on the veggie sandwich was too buttery and the amount of fries that came with the dish was disappointing, especially when the people next to our table had a plate full fries on THEIR veggie sandwich! The mac and cheese was bland..nothing awesome about it. This place was okay, but not somewhere I would go back to because the food was quite mediocre.

This was the first time I tried the famous Wisconsin beer cheese soup, and it was delicious. So cheesy and sooooo good. I had the regular burger, which was delicious with the fried egg and bacon on it. The patty was so thick and it really tasted like quality beef. Also the beer selection was awesome, with numerous local beers and at least 30 beers on tap. It was quite hard to decide but the Spotted Cow beer was a nice compliment to all of the cheese I had.
Excellent service very friendly and courteous staff if I am ever in Madison again I will be there. Highly recommended !!
Best cheese curds of any place in Madison. Hands down.

The Old Fashioned, totally rocks for its bar, restaurant, and awesome location at the epicenter of Madison.  It goes without saying that their Old Fashions are awesome, every food item I've ever tried in my 3 visits to the place has been delicious (especially the cheese curds).  A kick butt selection of Beers from Sconee to boot!!! Great place to come to meet friends or with the family. I'll be back the next time I'm in MadTown for a game or a visit.

Greasy, heavy food with no plant-based options. It's where the obese Madisonites stop to graze when their angina starts bothering them as they attempt to walk the capitol.   Switch to plant-based foods and overcome your diabetes, heart-disease, and obesity epidemics, Madison.

Had Brunch on a weekend. The wait time was 5 mins;  The food was served hot and quickly.The waiter helped with the menu choices and kept the coffee cup full. We had the Cheese platter, eggs and toast, Eggs Benedict with bratwurst. Really good value.

Best Old Fashioned I've had, with a great price. Great food with a great atmosphere. I've been here for lunch and dinner and loved it both times! Ive had the spicy burger and the prime rib sandwich and both were beyond good! The spinach and stravecchio salad should not be missed! I'd drive up from IL just to go here!
Consistently good. Flavorful burgers, good beer, nice armosphere. I have been there twice,  and plan to go back.
We sat by the window and had a nighttime view of the Capitol! Pub food is easy to come by in Madison, so we didn't feel like we were getting anything special here. We had no complaints though.

Given our experience on the evening of 26-Jan, I was very surprised to see this place get 4 stars.  Granted that the food was between good and very good, however the service was between bad and very bad.  Waitress attention was minimal, a meal was requested without onions but came with onions, and the bill was asked to be split between food and drinks and was not.  When the onion issue was pointed out the waiter set the plate down anyway.  From just the one experience I could not recommend this place to out of towners.
My Family of 5 is never disappointed with the food, service or ambience. Best cheese curds ever!

What the heck do you say about a place with 1200 reviews and an overall 4-star rating that hasn't already been said?   Without going back through all of them, let me give you two words: Lazy Susan. I honestly think this is the best-kept secret of The Old Fashioned.   One night awhile back, I was partying backstage at the Bartell with my castmates from Misalliance. We were STARVING, but didn't want to leave the cozy confines of the green room (and, more importantly, the beer and wine in the backstage fridge) to get something to eat. A couple folks said, "We'll go get some stuff from the Old Fashioned and bring it back." I handed them some bills and said, "Get a No. 6." "What's that?" "It's one of their lazy Susans." "Their what?" "Trust me - just order it."  Basically, the number 6 is everything you'd find set out as an appetizer before a holiday dinner in Wisconsin - cheese spread, braunschweiger, smoked trout, creamed herring, salami, deviled eggs, pickles - plus crackers and rye bread. It actually comes on a lazy Susan - so you can twirl it in the middle of the table for easy sampling. If you order it to go, they have a special lazy Susan go container for it, too. It doesn't twirl, but who cares. What's on it is going to disappear so quickly, it won't matter. And you will be very, very happy.  One word of caution: it's a lot of food. Depending on their appetites, a few people could make a whole meal out of the thing. Two people will not finish a number 6. Three people will not finish a number 6. You get the idea.  So why not five stars? Well, frankly - as many times as I've been to the Old Fashioned, I can tell you that sometimes the service isn't the friendliest. I know the place is always hopping and, by the end of the night, their servers' puppies have to be barkin' pretty loudly. But please smile at me - I will tip you well.

Great place for cheese curds and their namesake drink. Most of the food is enough for two people to share, especially the Friday fish fry. I've had most of the fish and vegetarian things on the menu and they were all good. Only downside is it is pretty loud around dinner time so sometimes it is difficult to talk and there is often a 45 minute wait for a table.

I recently have found a new love for old fanshions and thiers didn't dissapoint.  More about that later...A friend of mine were driving back from my lake house and we decided to stop here for some drinks and food.  The place was packed when we walked in and had about a 30min wait for a table...this doesn't bother me because I work in the same industry and you really need to piss me off for me not to like you...That being said we walked around their two bars trying to find a couple open chairs..no luck.  Soo..what do you do?  GRAB A BEER!  I starred blankly at their menu of beers for a good 10min before ordering and was plesnely suprised by lake fronts ipa.. delishious!  My friend got the new glaurs totally naked and it was on special for $2.50!  SWEET!  Eventually a couple bar stools came available and we scooped them up extremely quick.  By that time it was time for...yep another beer...seeing how long it took me to order the first i decided to grab a flight of 8..hehee..all WI beers and all were pretty good..the barback was cool and chatted with us a bit and didn't mind running from bar to bar to pour the flights (i guess you can only order beer flights from one side..hmm..whatever)   Food:  fried cheese curds..bomb...lake trout...bomb  night cap was an old fashion ordered by my lady friend so it was a sweet but frickin good!    The Old Fashioned is a must stop if in Madison!

The hype about the cheese curds is true.  They are that good.  The place would get a 5-star from me on them alone if not for all of the other great meals they served up.  They're all about being Wisconsin, and I can't imagine anyone else doing it better.  Get there early, but get there somehow.  This place is a real treat.  Also, if you don't get to Wisconsin often, make certain that you get a flight of Wisconsin beers.  Your server will select them for you if you give a little direction.  Oh, and don't forget the fried pickle spears--crispy on the outside, pickley good on the inside.

Let me preface my review with "I am not a native Wisconsinite".  I don't even drink Bloody Marys.  The food is pretty good.  You have to be in the mood for sandwiches or a greasy food.  The cheese curds are good, but not my favorite in town.  The bar food menu is interesting and I do love their popcorn.
Best cheese curds in Madison! Great menu. Lots to choose from. Friendly service. Great selection of beers, too. Went here straight from the airport.

I would definitely stop by again when i'm back in wisconsin =)   i went there for lunch and it was getting really crowded. it was a neat restaurant that offers a TON of beer selection!!!  the service was ok.    i ordered the Old Fashioned House Burger.  Their burger was sooo big that i had to eat with fork and knife!!!!  soft cooked egg oozing over thick slices of bacon and topped with fried onions.... it's a perfect combo!!! garlic sauce enhaced the whole experience... oh so good!!!! their bread was so yummy... oh gosh i'm drooling as i type this! i usually don't rave about hamburgers but i'm totally raving this one!!!!  Mmmmm... cheesecurds... that was the main attraction and i'm so glad i did~  i had to bring some back to California!!! it was quite tasty!!!  it was a bit salty in my opinion, but loved the chewy inside!! almost reminded me of fried mozarella but with more flavor!! i wonder if i can make this at home =)   If you're in the area or driving through the capital, totally should stop by this place and try their food!

I have eaten at The Old Fashioned for several years, and have never been disappointed!  It is good old Wisconsin comfort food at its best, with appetizers that include Wisconsin's Best Wurst Platter, Soups that include Wisconsin Beer Cheese Soup garnished with Popcorn (yes, really!), Entrees that include The Old Fashioned Burger, grilled over a live fire and topped with fried onions, Bavaria's hickory-smoked bacon, aged Cheddar, garlic sauce and a soft-cooked egg on a buttered and toasted roll...  How good is that!  Don't eat here if you worry about cholesterol!  They also have great cheese curds!  The ambiance is of a bustling and lively place, with a great selection of beers.  It just doesn't get better than this!  Another Madison great!
A little overhyped in my opinion.  Good burgers but not the greatest I've had.  Fun atmosphere and solid experience but could do work a little on diversification of their menu items.

Was there with large group Sat in front and every time some one came thru from door we got a frigid breeze Awful!!!! Wedge salad with grilled chicken good Homemade chips excellent 2 people in our group had to send spilt pea soup back because too salting Friendly wait staff
The burgers as well as the Old Fashioned drinks are really good. Parking is hassle (as with anywhere downtown). Be prepared to wait.

Seems to be living off of its institutional status. Most everything has been said.   The burgers are amazing. The grass fed beef and commitment to local produce is impressive. This might just be the best grass fed burger we've ever had. Quite unbelievable.   Why not 5 stars? $1 up-charge for tomato on a regular burger. That's a bit cheap. Especially when you ask for no cheese and you paid for the cheese. At least it turns out this is an heirloom tomato because it is in season. So that's a plus. It was a really good slice of tomato!
Awesome atmosphere for Badger game day!  Great cheese curds and chili!  Great service too!

The service was almost as great as the food. We had an incredible server who made great recommendations and suggested specials. Good thing because everything was the best. There was an amazing Sunday special of impecibly seasoned chicken, stuffing and potatoes. YUM! We also had fried cheese curds. Duh, it's WI. And a house brew beer to accompany. Will be back time and time again!
Came here two days in a row for breakfast and brunch- Enough said?  Eggs were perfect, toast and peach jam and rosemary potato!! Yummy

Delicious food, but do not expect to run a mile after enjoying a buttery sandwich with cheese curds on the side. The name describes the ambiance, especially in regards to the bar. Expect it to be fairly busy, as it is on "the square". They also serve breakfast, but I find the lunch/dinner menu more unique.

I really love the Old Fashioned's atmosphere and their food.  They are part of the slow food movement, relying on local, organic produce whenever possible, and they take great pride in what they do. The restaurant is a gourmet showcase of all things Wisconsin with prices to fit all budgets.  The generous cup of Green Bay chili costs only about $4.50 and will come very close to filling you up.  Get a tap beer while you are there and you've escaped for less than $10.  They have a long, luxurious wood bar, and nearly everything on the menu is very good.
Food was awesome, service is slow and not the most friendly bunch I've ever been around.
great cocktails and food! a must place to visit if you visiting town!

Wow this is really not worth the wait.  Everyone recommends it I guess because it is so well known.  Staff are very rude.  They seem to think they are "all that".  Mediocre experience, way to loud and not worth the wait to get a table.

The Old Fashioned is a great place for groups. They have a variety of sandwiches and daily specials that cater to whatever need you have. Our table ordered a side of cheese and crackers (came with three types of cheeses that were all fantastic), and a variety of sausage that came was also awesome. They make some very soft macaroni and cheese that is topped with bread crumbs. It comes in a mini boat style plate that comes with a large quantity of macaroni and cheese. Their prime rib sandwich is average (the meat is fairly tender but doesn't go too well with the bread and it also comes out extremely juicy which makes the bread a bit soggy).  They also have a wide range of drinks. Their hard apple cider shot is really good. It balances that cider taste with a slight bit of alcohol.

I have only been for brunch but it is very good.  They have a version of eggs benedict using a brat patty instead of canadian bacon which is out of this world.  Also their potatoes are awesome, I think they are battered and deepfried with rosemary.  I also had the special which involved sage sausage and onions scrambled eggs and cheddar, much of which supposedly came from the farmers market right outside the door.  Its more casual than I expected after reading reviews here.
Absolute...... Best old fashioneds on this side of the Mississippi!!!! If you come to Madison you absolutely have to come here! They also have really good cheese platters!!!
This place has the most underrated burger in Madison (the one that comes with Bacon and a fried egg).  Just try it and thank me.  You're welcome.

Great location, cool ambiance, attentive staff, FANTASTIC beer selection! My husband and I just stopped by for a few drinks, The Old Fashioned has a great two for one happy hour. There are tons of beer on tap (maybe a couple dozen?) and they're all Wisconsin brewed. I'll definitely go back next time I'm in Madison to try some stuff off the really good sounding menu (lots of cheese, no surprise there!!!).

Service is always slow, and it's always packed, but the food is worth it.  Try the cheese curds, even if you think that's not your thing.  They're heavy and you feel stuffed, but they're the best cheese curds in Wisconsin (and trust me, I've hunted!).  YUM!

The Old Fashioned is so Wisconsin. The food is great and so is the beer! They are known for their cheese curds, so if you love cheese and you love anything fried, try them! This is the go-to place for when you're visiting Madison, or you have friends in town - great atmosphere (can get loud) and it's right on the Cap Square. They also offer a rewards card, though I always forget to use mine. Ha!   One warning, no matter the time or day of the week, expect a lengthy line - people are always waiting to get in. Regardless of the wait, it's worth it!
awesome steak and great time.. tried the cheese curds and cheese platter followed by steak. aviation martini at the end. food was really good. great ambulance. would come here again..

This was one of our first experiences upon moving to Madison, and even a takeout order of two sandwiches and cheese curds was amazing! Service was very friendly and everything was ready in time and hot. We look forward to trying more of their menu!

Nummy nummy num! Deliciousness is everywhere, from the bar to the tables. Don't miss the Saturday morning brunch during farmers markets! I've never had anything that wasn't wonderful. Just don't go there if you're in a hurry, because there's almost always a wait for a table!

Visited here with some colleagues last month. As someone not from the WI area, it seemed like a very typical bar and restaurant. It is located near the Capitol, and was definitely crowded and we had a bit of a wait before we had a table. A few of us got drinks and cheese curds while we waited. I will remember the Old fashioned and the first place I have ever tried cheese curds as well the first time I actually enjoyed a beer! Since it was the first time I ever had cheese curds, I didn't really have anything to compare it with. While anything fried is always good, their cheese curds were intense and a bit on the saltier side. I prefer the cheese curds at other locations in the area. Even though I normally don't like beer, I also decided to try some of the WI beers they had, and the bar tender let me try a belgian red cherry beer from New Glarus that was delicious! For dinner, I ordered a Mac and cheese which while good, did not stand out for me.

The old fashioned can be ordered in many variations, and is delicious. The beer cheese soup was really good, and the salad with door county cherries was tasty too. Great service even though it was super busy. Great Madison ambience.

While I am not obsessed with this place like some people are, I do really like it.  The menu is not huge, so it is a bit hard for a picky eater (and not so much meat lover) like me to find something to eat sometimes.  That being said, everything I have had there has been very good.  The things that I do really love there: The drinks, and the cheese curds.  Definitely top notch.  Also worth noting:  the place is so popular that really whatever time you go to eat it will be crowded, and it will be a bit noisy.

First off, I really hate waiting around for a table, so the fact that I go here even when they don't take reservations should tell you something.  The Mr. and I have been here several times, weekends mostly, and I'm always up for their Friday fish fry.  Can't remember which night (Tues, mayhap?) but Taco Night is also interesting, in a good way.  You must order whatever the drink special of the evening is- each time I've been amazed at old Wisconsin drinks I've never heard of before.  Bartenders are attentive and friendly, the location's great and I've never had a bad meal or experience here.

There is just soooo much here....the menu is vast, the beer and liquor is vaster.    But since I've been coming here on the regular for the last six years, the singular item I have come to appreciate is the $1.50 beef jerky.  This has got to be the most under appreciated item on any menu in any Madison restaurant.  The saltiness revives your palette for the next craft beer.  The protein sates you.  The leathery texture builds jaw strength.    So while I could ramble on about the curds, the burgers, the fish-fry, the whiskey, the lazy susans - I am just going to leave you with two words:  bar meat.
Get the fish fry every time, whether it's Friday or on the sandwich any other day.  It's simply the best there is!

High quality low brow eats. My first time in Madison. I went for the deep fried cheese curds - creamy and delicious - then a BLT with farm fresh lettuce and heirloom tomatoes. Fantastic. There's a great craft brew list but I washed mine down with a couple of bottles of Miller High Life. Perfect.

What a dumpster!  I've been here twice.  Will NEVER COME AGAIN!  I came with my wife and a friend of hers to have a drink while they ate dinner.  I brought my own food due to my food allergies and I was told I had to leave.  I came here once before all of my food allergies and had cold terrible food and was seated by the door in the winter and froze my butt off.  NEVER AGAIN
One of my favorite lunch spots in Madison. Great for lunch or dinner. Get the Wisconsin cheese soup!  Evenings the bar is a good place to take in some Wisconsin microbrew's.

I believe it was Public Enemy who said "Don't believe the hype!" The place is good. Good concept. Good service. Good food. But a 2+ hour wait for two? A 1.5 hour wait for two on a Saturday at 2:00 PM? I mean, the place is good, but I have to suspect that something is amiss with table/time management. For all the good it has, I don't think I'd wait more than half an hour with all the other fine establishments nearby. That's exactly what my friend and I did both times. We were pleased with our meals and service elsewhere - including a nearby vendor cart. Honestly, don't wait more than 30 minutes - otherwise, you're just a fool.
Love the cheese curds!!  Best in Madison. Menu selection is huge but everything is so good. Waited 30 min for a table last Friday we went, but worth it!!
Great food! Great drinks! Great beer on tap! It's very hard to have a conversation at TOF. Bouncy sound.

Typical Midwest Bar, bar food and of course Old Fashioned in 8 different variations. Crowd is mostly college students and some "professional drinkers". Great place to inhale the Wisconsin tradition of drinking. The prices are very reasonable ( cocktail 5 to 7 bucks) and if you happen to be here at happy hour you almost get paid to drink.

Recommend this place for folks who visit Madison. Awesome beer selection. The weekly beer special was really tasty and reasonably priced. Enjoyed the Wisconsin burger. It was very crowded, but the wait was not bad.

really good food and drinks, well worth the 30 minute wait.   We were told the wait would be 1.25 hrs but it turned out to be much shorter.  It's loud, had to shout a bit. Sausage appetizer platter was amazing.

First time I came here I had the grilled cheese which is lot memorable. I also had the cheese curds (obviously) which are great with the garlic sauce!!  Second time I had the Mac and cheese with their matchstick fries. The Mac is so so so good!! Would definitely recommend. Wait can be long but they text when your table is ready.  Server was really friendly (:

We stopped in here while walking around the capitol. It drew a good crowd on a Wednesday evening; we probably waited half an hour to get seated. I had the lake perch and it was delicious.   The menu has a good variety, and they have a huge selection of beers. I would definitely recommend it if you happened to be in the neighborhood.

This place is popular. You will be waiting! That being said, I'm a college student from California and here's what I think:  Interior/Ambiance: Dim, but not too dim. Very inviting, yet busy...you'll be needing to speak up.  The food: There's something for everyone, and it's ALL great, and it is ALL very reasonably priced. Full-sized burger and shoestring onion fries for $10. What more could you want? Don't let the price fool you--the food is of EXCELLENT quality.  Service: I've learned that everyone in Wisconsin is super nice, and these servers are no different. Yes, they'll be busy, but once you get their attention, they're very concerned and helpful and pleasant.  BOTTOM LINE: Come here. Just come here.

While the food at the old fashioned always tastes great, the service is always so poor. There have been multiple ocassions where my party could not get a waitress, drinks, or even the bill. Last night I brought a party of 6 and was seated and brought out waters by the host but after 15 minutes and no server we took our money and went elsewhere. On a separate night with the same party we ordered a pitcher of beer only to see our waitress had pulled up a seat at the bar! Realizing she had checked out for the night a member of our table ordered our pitcher directly at the bar, 20 minutes and half a pitcher later guess who comes to our table with our pitcher? unbelievable.  Yes they have great food and a wide selection of beers which is why I keep coming back but I would love to leave the old fashioned feeling like we had great service as well.

This review is based solely on their brunch.  The food that came out seemed to be prepared well enough so as far as taste goes I have no complaints but I felt that the brunch menu itself was very limited especially in vegetarian options.  And it's just my personal opinion that an egg scramble is simply the lazy man's omelet but I can't really fault them for that as the egg was tasty enough.  The food was prepared very fast though and the general atmosphere seemed okay for the type of place that seems to be typical student fare.  I won't return for brunch but I'll try the dinner menu some time soon to see how that holds up.
Best Cheese Curds on the planet.  Meals are good as well.  Solid place all around (quality, portions, price, atmosphere, etc).  Very good.

What can I say that hasn't already said about The Old Fashioned? Probably nothing.   This might be Madison's most popular restaurant. I'm genuinely surprised when it's not full and people don't seem to have a problem waiting an hour to get in.    Pros: -Top notch service  -Sets the standards for Madison's bar food scene  -Excellent atmosphere that's the right balance of kitsch and class   Cons: -Man, this place is always busy. Expect a wait for a table.

The Old Fashioned is far from its name. It's full of energy and in the midst of a college town in Michigan. They offer great mixed drinks at a decent price and their food is fantastic. The one item I will suggest, no matter what your pallet, is the cheese curds. They are one of the best appetizers I've had in any restaurant and come with a multitude of sauces for dipping (provided you pay a little extra for each). Well worth it.

The was a nice casual restaurant near the Capitol. It was busy when we got there, but they gave us discounted drink tickets, and what's not to like about that. Plus, our wait was only like 10-15 min, which wasn't bad at all. The place is noisy, not because there is blaring music, it must just be the acoustics of the building and all of the people. The wait staff was friendly and attentive. The food was delicious. I would definitely come back.

The burger with the egg, which I believe is number #30 is amazing! I always say if your burger/sandwich isn't messy, it isn't good. And this one drips down your hands and forearms with deliciousness. I've never gotten anything else at the Old Fashioned, and while I'm sure everything is good, I have no plans to try anything else.

My go-to is the wedge salad with blue cheese and door county cherries. Love the Apple Jack old fashioned and you can't go wrong with a little bit of their famous small batch Cherry Bounce during the winter.  TIP: Tiger sauce with the cheese curds

The cheese curds are hyped up. It's a solid place, and their mac n cheese is a good option. The cheese curds were solid but again hyped up. I felt like I had them before... and finally remembered, this tastes like T.G.I. Friday's mozzarella sticks that you get frozen from the grocery store.
Solid heavy handed pours and an awesome selection of cocktails.   They muddle hard...and I respect that!

This a top-ten restaurant in Madison, which has more restaurants than is reasonable for a town its size. Great for brunch on weekends - their scrambles use local ingredients and are always tasty with excellent rosemary potatoes. Excellent bloody marys as well. It's very Wisconsin - Wisconsin beers that are reasonably priced, pickled meats and veggies, and cheese boards. The cheese curds are to die for.
Place was absolutely packed but they got us in very quickly considering. Ending up ordering the Wisconsin burger, one of the best burgers I've ever had!

I come to Madison a few times a year, and I always find time to stop by this place, which I think is one of the best bars in America.  Start with the ridiculous beer list, which has about 50 brews on tap and all of them are from the state of Wisconsin. It's epic.  The food is also excellent. I've had the cheese plate, the sausage plate, a burger with onion straws and cheese curds, and they've all been terrific.  Love the atmosphere in here. It's far enough away from the campus hangouts to attract a more adult crowd. It's casual but not too casual. There are a couple of TVs but it's a place you can have a conversation. And there's a great view of the Capitol right across the street.  Service has always been top notch. Love this place and how it always makes me feel like I'm in Wisconsin. Can't wait to go back.
Amazing food and great Wisconsin choices. If you are looking for a down-to-earth, comfort food meal, look no further! Bar staff was amazing as well. Good people and very kind.

I've been here twice and only had these things: beer, cheese curds, and fish & chips.  That being said, I am a fan.  Though I am almost always a fan of these things.  The shining star for me is the cheese curds.  Though, cheese always shines for me.  I love you, cheese.  Don't ever leave me.  Our party of 10 ordered 1 basket, then 2 baskets - and they were gone in the blink of an eye.  I'm salivating a bit just thinking about them.  Service is good, except they won't split your checks.  So keep that in mind as you overpay for your dinner because someone at your table is being cheap - or worse, left without paying.  Ugh.  They have karaoke on Wednesdays, with an impressive collection for a traveling act.  Karaoke for me gets old after a couple hours, but it was fun while it lasted.
Food was ok, I was expecting more in terms of taste, fish I ordered a bit smelly, the drinks were great, price was great, very reasonable

Amazing breakfast, deserves 5 stars!!  I had the corn beef and hash.  This was amazing!  My husband had a omelet and it was also delicious!  We started with the fresh made donuts with powered sugar.  I could have eaten 3 plates of these.  Server was great as well.  We will be back for sure!!
Long wait but the food was very good.  Cheese curds were wonderful.  They ran out of hot dogs which was surprising.
Good solid Wisconsin food and popular watering hole. The cheese curds are a staple for anyone's first time.

Out of towners from Florida here (but originally from Wi). Came for dinner, but were also hoping to have an interesting beer. This place has 52 draft choices, and all crafts from Wi!! Had a few while waiting for our meal.  I had the No. 30 which is a burger with sauted onions and a fried egg on it. By far the best burger I've had! I could have licked the plate!   I am now hoping my son chooses UWM so I can come back here more often!

So overrated. It's very sad to hear people recommend this place to out-of-town guests because it's representative "Wisconsin food" or something. Greasy, mediocre food is NOT doing a great job representing Wisconsin. There are many wonderful restaurants just a block (or less!) away that do much better justice to Wisconsin with fresh, local, innovating cuisine... why would you waste your time on a regular greasy cheeseburger or just-okay fried cheese curds.  If you're going to go, go for the Wednesday night karaoke and two-for-one, not for dinner. If you're looking for food, please do yourself a favor and walk in either direction.

I am delighted that two years later I love this place. Great atmosphere and  yummy food. We went on a Tuesday night and the $1.50 tacos were surprisingly yummy. Not to mention the mac n cheese is pretty incredible. Everyone including the kids were thrilled with their dinners. Definitely a great place for after work drinks, dinner with friends or the whole family. A Madison must!
The good, atmosphere, menu & service was great.  I had the fried cheese curds, which were excellent.  Next visit I'll try some brats or a Wisconsin cheese plate.

This was such a cool treat!  There was a 45 minute wait on Saturday morning, but we grabbed 2 seats at the bar from brunch.  Short version- food was great, bar tender was a trip, and price was really reasonable!  Great experience !  I have the chicken fried steak and my wife had a cheeseburger while we shared cheese curds. Both were were memory makers!  Homemade goodness but it's very best.  Our bartender was an absolute hoot - he was like Nick Swardson - but still trying to figure out being funny - more organic.   He kept singing hall and Oates songs.   After our meal we grabbed a bar side, locally sourced beef stick that was somewhere between indescribable, and indescribably good.  Nothing I can say will give it the due it deserves... The only thing that would've made it better would be if I were totally hung over when I ate it and I eat it for three days a little bit at a time because it was so rich.    We will be back and I can't wait!

Nom nom nom!  I love the lazy suzans and the burgers here.  The walleye sandwich was also good, but oh, my, the lazy suzans are fun!  We also like the vodka variety.  Be prepared, though, this place always seems to be packed, and for good reason.

I've been to the Old Fashioned quite a few times since it opened in 2005 and I've never come away disappointed.  I especially enjoy how the restaurant has improved on the traditional Wisconsin fare that is found in supper clubs throughout the state.  I enjoy the classic supper clubs as much as the next guy, but in my opinion the Old Fashioned exceeds these establishments by using higher quality local ingredients and a fresh dose of experimentation.  Now it should be stressed that the Old Fashioned is NOT a supper club.  I've gone there with friends that were under this impression, and it lessened their opinions of the place because they were expecting the usual prime rib specials and relish tray.  No, this is a downtown restaurant and bar on the Square, with food that combines the traditional with modern flavors.  The food at the Old Fashioned is the main reason I never hesitate in coming back.  I'm especially fond of the roast beef tenderloin sandwich (#42) - maybe my favorite roast beef sandwich of all time.  The turkey breast and the pulled pork are also perfectly balanced sandwiches, and the chicken (#37 - sans the mayo) is another stand-by.  I haven't screwed up the courage to order the summer sausage sandwich quite yet, but every time I inch a bit closer to doing so.  The Old Fashioned Burger, with fried onions, bacon, cheddar and an egg, has always looked to be too much for me, but my friend ordered it last night and he indicated that I should not miss the opportunity in the future.  The side salads that come with the sandwiches are very good, but I have a hard time passing up the fries, which are perfectly salted and crispy.  I would also suggest trying one of the cheese platters before a meal, especially if someone else is buying.  The bar is well-stocked and there is an excellent tap selection of local brews.  There always seems to be running specials (last night was pitchers of Tyranena Honey Blonde for $9).  I have not tried the signature cocktail, however.  I'm not partial to brandy, but my mother, an aficienado of the brandy old fashioned sweet if there ever was one, enjoyed hers, though she was quick to point out that the drink at "her" bar will always be the undisputed king.  The only drawbacks to the place are that it can get loud and that it is seemingly always busy.  Fortunately you can order from the bar instead of wait for a table, and the meals tend to come quickly when you're at the bar, which helps speed things along if you're in a hurry.  The entree prices are a bit on the high side but balance out with the drink specials, so overall the place is a pretty good value for downtown.

The last time I was in Madison I ate here twice in one day.  That, I believe, is a testament to my faith in and adoration for this establishment.    The burgers are reliably first rate and the paprika sauce is so good that I would bathe it in.  It would probably have good effects on the skin anyway.  The drink specials are usually pretty great too - each month they  feature a local-ish brew which they sell for cheap and the "double bubble" special on some weeknights from 10:30pm to midnight allows you to get  2 for 1 taps and rail mixers.    This restaurant encapsulates my profound love for Wisconsin.

This is my kind of place and with some of the best drink prices for a nicer place I have seen.   Get aged cheese curds...they're worth the price. Enjoy more than one old fashioned brandy (sweet) as you cannot drink enough of these while in Madison. Brandy old fashioned has completely raised the bar on how good a cocktail can taste.

Had a wonderful meal today. My wife and I shared the Lazy Susan platter and the Sausage platter. Great samples of German sausages, fish, pickles, cheese spreads, liver sausage, deviled eggs, sour kraut, pickled green beans and breads. We both had old fashions which were also good. A must go place.
Be patient at lunch time, excellent food, great drinks, craft beer, convenient location.

We love the Old Fashioned for Sunday brunch, lunch, cocktails or dinner. Do I have everything covered? Friday fish fry is great. Cheese curds and rings are terrific. Brats are vintage Cheboygan. If I am in the mood for brats I usually get the double.  If there is one restaurant/bar in the Madison area that will provide the true Madison experience this is the place. As an added bonus It's also right across the street from our beautiful state capital and, from April to October, the capital square hosts a world class Farmer's Market on Saturdays from sunrise until early afternoon. If there's a long wait for a table try to grab a spot at the bar for your meal. Bar service is top notch!  One more thing...DON'T leave without trying an Old Fashioned. You will order a second! I prefer mine with Maker's Mark and sour! Simply Awesome!

Super location across from the Capitol building with lots of people walking about. I went on a Saturday for lunch at 12:30 and the place was packed. We put our names in for a 30-minute wait but found two seats at the bar right away. We took those instead and I'm really glad we did because Nick, our bartender was a good guy to have serving us.  I ordered the Old Fashioned to help get rid of my cough (HONEST!) and my friend ordered the House Brew which is a dark, rich and flavorful beer, kind of dunkel-y, maybe?. Anyway, both were delicious but I wish I would have ordered the bourbon old fashioned instead of the Korbel. The brandy was OK .. I just missed the bourbon taste.  Since The Old Fashioned prides itself on providing the Wisconsin experience, we ordered the house-made cheese curds to start. Holy heart attack, those suckers were good, cheese oozing out of a lite batter, with some ranch on the side. I imagine they sell a boatload of those things late at night when folks have reached a certain level of intoxication. Continuing with the Wisconsin theme, I got the #32 brat with some potato salad and pretty much devoured it. I got a nice grilled brat with some raw onion and pickles with mustard on a bun. Great flavor, snap from the brat and mustard, and texture from the raw onion and pickles. The potato salad was creamy and slightly dilly .. a good choice for the well-seasoned brat. My companion ordered the summer sausage w/muenster on rye and really enjoyed it. He got the onion straws and they were super crispy and sweet, the perfect compliment to the summer sausage. He said he wished he would have ordered the sauerkraut with his sandwich but the mustard provided a little kick and I liked it just the way that it was. After the curds, the main course and another old fashioned, I had no room for dessert. But my cough was better, so there's that.  There's a lot to love about The Old Fashioned, most of it because they're everything they claim to be. With it's location alone, it could easily have gone the touristy route but I found it to be completely authentic. I love that they stick to the Wisconsin roots and that a fair amount of food is locally sourced, which is important to me. Their beer selection is phenomenal and despite being super busy, our service was friendly and fast. Looking back, I almost wish it would have been delayed because there's a lot to take in at that place and since I was only there on a day trip from Iowa, I wanted to savor the experience.  The good news is that it's only a couple hours away and I can easily come back!

I had to try deep fried cheese curds...it was my first visit to Madison, after all. I asked for the best in town and went where I was told.  Parking was not easy ...but that's a Madison thing...and the cheese curds were even more awesome than I'd expected. Like mac 'n cheese without the mac.  Yummy enough to join the Badger brats n' curds bandwagon.

You gotta try the crispy onion strands, they are the best! Such an extensive beer menu,, only problem with it is that it only has Wisconsin beers, would be nice if it included some micro brews from our neighboring states. Love the layout of the space. If your only in town for a few days this is a great place to experience Wisconsin on your table. Karakee night is a little loud, but I just dont enjoy karaokee in the first place so that would be a hard sell for me.

New favorite: #35 Veggie sandwich  So I know I said the meats here are great - AND they are! But for summertime, this veggie sandwich is amazing. Yes it has the typical boring veggies: portabella mushroom, red pepper and zucchini, but where it really shines is the perfectly grilled eggplant (texture is similar to the portabella and intakes surrounding flavors when done correct), goat cheese and BLACK OLIVE tapenade. These last 3 flavors combine perfectly. It's not a simple pesto item, it's more thoughtful. I can't have the cheese (my partner swears by it), but that olive tapenade  - I mean, I could just eat that on bread and be perfectly happy. The veggies add filling.   I still love: Old Fashioneds Huge tap menu #37 chicken breast with bacon, mustard/mayo French fries Pickled egg Eggs Benedict - veggie or ham, with/out hollandaise sauce
Love their cheese curds!   This place is the definition of Wisconsin food.

Food is superb to say the least. I went there based on past reviews. The place was packed and the aroma was enticing. I had the Sunday chicken special since the bartender recommended it. It was one of the best chicken I've eaten. I went to work bragging on the great food and staff.

Awesome sandwiches and great Old Fashioned and Bloody Mary.  Grilled Summer Sausage was great, cheeseburger with egg was very good.  Cheese curds are worth the extra $3.00 cost as a side.  Only one our party needed to upgrade to the curds in order to share
Exactly what I wanted on my trip to Madison. Fried cheesy goodness on a plate, great beers, and friendly service. An enjoyable experience in every way.

I had lunch here with some colleagues.  It was a pretty decent lunch.  I had a battered walleye sandwich.  The fish and batter were excellent.  I really enjoyed the lightness of the fish with just the right seasonings and crunch.  The accompanying sauce was about average, a good compliment to the fish.  The bread used was nice, but I think it was a bit too buttered in the toasting process.  It made it a bit too greasy.   I was impressed with their beer selection and would be interested in going back some day to try a few more.

Had a really great time at The Old Fashioned while passing through town. The wait for a party of 3 was about 45 minutes on a Monday, but they have an excellent system that texts you when your table is ready, and have two full bars you can order from while you wait.   There are 50 different Wisconsin-brewed beers on tap to choose from, as well as many more in bottles. Even though it was busy, the bartender was very attentive and had great beer suggestions.   When it came time to sit down, we ordered a pitcher of a regionally-brewed Mexican style beer  (on special for $11!), a plate of fried cheese curds with a horseradish dipping sauce, and the wurst plate - three different sausages made with Wisconsin beer, served with two delicious mustards, sauerkraut, pickled green beans, and fresh-out-of-the-oven dark bread. The curds were tasty as expected, but the sausages, bread and mustards stole the show. Each sausage was perfectly cooked and well complimented by the sauerkraut and pickled beans.   For entrees, we all ordered burgers. The Monday special was two classic cheeseburgers - Wisconsin cheddar, onions, mayo, pickle, and lettuce - for $8.95. Two of us did that, and our third party ordered the spicy burger with jalapeno cheese. The burgers were flavorful and juicy (cooked medium to medium-rare) and the cheese is not to be beat.   Our whole bill, excluding the beers while waiting for our table, was just under $55. On the value scale, The Old Fashioned ranks near the top. I'll be back my next time through Wisconsin.

If you go for nothing else then go and try their delicious and reasonably priced cocktails. I personally had their Brandy Old Fashioned and their Manhattan. Their old fashioned was one of the best I've had, and while I wasn't a huge fan of the Manhattan, I think that has more to do with my personal tastes for bourbon.  Then since you're already there, you may as well go ahead and eat since the food is all delicious, especially the burgers.

Burger and cheese curds? Yes please! This is a higher end place where you'll get a juicy burger and fried cheese curds with a melty inside but not overly greasy.   Order takeout for lunch (they get really busy so call ahead) then go find a place to sit on the capital lawn or bench and listen to the musical performances as you enjoy your food!

Was visiting for work last week with two coworkers. We had to try this place since it had 4 stars and so many reviews. We had the cheese curds of course which were amazing and the beer cheese soup which was also tasty. For our entrees we had the rib sandwich, the burger, and the chicken and swiss sandwich. The sandwiches were just ok but I liked that they came with the choice of mixed greens. The fries were also good. Everything was very reasonably priced and the service was great.

Great cheese curds, we enjoyed the paprika dip on them. The perch was good, it had a very nice breading, not too heavy like so many places.   The location is fun. We went on a Friday evening, so it was about an hour and 15 minute wait, but we were able to get drinks at the bar while we waited.

I really wanted to love this place - but decided it came out to yelp's A-OK.  We ordered the No. 30 (burger with egg) with cheese curds and the No. 36 (beer battered wall-eye sandwich).  The burger was a bit overcooked.  The cheese curds were too oily for me.  We noticed that the guys sitting beside us barely touched their cheese curds, and I'm guessing that may have been the reason.  Every time you take a bite, your mouth fills with oil.  I'm such a cheese lover, so you can imagine how disappointed I was.  My favorite part of the meal was my fish sandwich - although I think using a softer bread for contrast would have worked better than the crunchy toast they used.  Flavors were good, maybe they were off on the cheese curds that day (needed to drain the oil longer?)...unfortunately, I won't have the chance to return (out of towner) to give them another chance.

The Old Fashioned is the quintessential Madison restaurant. An enormous beer selection (props to the abundance of hard to find microbrews on tap) and the cheeeeese!! The cheese curds are heaven!! And although I've yet to personally try it, I've heard from two fellow restaurant-goers that the walleye sandwich is "The best fish sandwich they have EVER tasted."   Aside from the excellent food, the old Schlitz memorabilia and general nostalgic Wisconsin decor make for a memorable visit. I agree with many of the other reviewers- this is definitely THE restaurant to take someone who is visiting from out of town. It truly highlights the best things about Wisconsin. And by best things, I mean beer and cheese of course!

We were descending in the hotel elevator with the hotel chef. My hubby asked him where he likes to eat and he told us to go to The Old Fashioned! We've been here several times since, whenever we're in Madison, and we like it every time. It's lively, crowded, noisy. Yes, you will wait for a table or spot at the bar, and yes, you will order an Old Fashioned and be delighted. There's many permutations of this drink here, so try a couple. The food is not the biggest draw - I've had the Wisconsin cheese beer soup, cheese plate (now that's a good choice for sure), the prime rib sandwich (good), fish fry. Just don't ignore your neighbor at the bar who says "Pass on the Green Bay Chili, it's not that good." I didn't take her advice and she was right. But it's so great in here, pretty good food is good enough.

Not a bad place at all.  We stopped in for dinner and there was a wait - over 60 minutes.  The wait seemed a bit excessive - especially for a Monday night.  But we were i town for a convention so that may be why.   Before I begin - think of this as a nice college beer joint where you can get good pub food.    We started with the cheese curds - nice but those are some serious belly bombers.    Then we had a veggie platter and that was nice.  I had the burger special and it was cooked exactly to order.    The wait staff was very nice and accommodating.    If we didn't have over an hour wait - add a star.
Very good food, lot of beer selection. Got the old fashioned house burger. Only downside to this place is it can be crowded and loud.

Great spot for drinks and snacks!  I made my own old fashioned and it was delicious. Such a neat idea!  We also tried the cheese plates and spreads.....all super yummy.  This was my first time in Madison and everyone said  I had to go to Old Fashioned....they were right!
I was between a 3 & 4, but remembered they have the best cheese curds I've ever had. Good fries too. MAC & cheese is usually pretty good. Fish fry's not the best I've had. Nice atmosphere.

Took a little 2 day vacay to the Madison area and The Old Fashioned was our find for lunch.  To say the parking was ridiculous was an understatement, but it was around 12:30 in the afternoon on a weekday...parking around the capital is going to be a disaster on a weekday afternoon.  When we walked in there seemed to be a long line, but it was just a party of 13 that walked in off the street and seemed surprised it would be a 45 minute wait to seat a party of that size with no notice...hint: NEVER show up at a restaurant with a party of that size without calling first!!
