Salami and white cheese were good, White was better than orange cheese. It had no taste. Was it worth the 16 dollars for the Ritz and a few slices of bread, meh not so much but OK. Get me that Bird Cage, bring us the Mac and Cheese, bring us a few burgers 1 with an egg. This is THE place to be. Still had optimistic hopes  Sadly no more Bird Cage? Wha?!!!?! Huge Bummer. Burgers were cooked order. I had the spicy burger and friend had regular. I did not taste any extra spice, but I appreciated it being medium rare. Bacon was good. I had the bunless and egg. They charge 1.50 for a bun and a 1.00 for the egg. Cheese curds were good, but lost on 1/2 of us, but happy we had a chance to try.  I have tried them and now can say I did. Burgers come with fries or salad. I opted for salad, dressing had no flavor, so I asked for a different 1. No flavor again. Gave up, had enough to call it a dinner.  Egg was cooked nicely. OK meal. Not too expensive except the Lazy Susan...not really worth the price tag.  No Bird Cage. Large Whiskey and Beer selection, decent wine and on the back of the drink menu it said Booze. Funny.   Ready to call it a night waiting for the check. One of our dishes was the Mac and Cheese. This was supposed to be the signature dish. It was cooked awful. It tasted like they messed up the flour to cheese and butter ratio. It was not good. We left 2/3 rds on the table. Mentioned this to the server not having the best day and she did not say anything, zero zilch. Also one of our glasses was chipped. We handed that over. Again, nothing was said. Nothing was fixed.  Seriously!!??!?!! My last statement was, you may not want to serve that again, it was not good. Again nothing. Not even, gosh that sucks, or sorry, or thanks for bringing me the glass that could have cut one's lip...nada. Left a bad impression.   Why someone would wait in line for more than 15 minutes is something I do not comprehend. If the lunch was served quickly for the downtown workers, I would see this as a regular albeit OK spot, but nothing to write much more about.   If coming for your Epic training, this is not one of the must have to try places.

I mean, I don't really have anything new to add. It's such a great "Wisconsin" place i.e. great cheese curds and beers. Old fashions were cheap too, so that's even better. The wait might be a little long, but just grab a beer and hang out. Would totally recommend!

Probably a 3.5.    This was our first time in Madison, and I decided I was going to have cheese curds come hell or high water, since I'd also never had those before!    Around the table was a sandwich, a burger, and lots of curds and fried onions.  The curds and the onions were a bit of a highlight, but I felt so guilty afterwards...I suppose I should've been better prepared for that.  Otherwise, the meal seemed like fairly standard bar fare - great for a diet-busting lunch!  Prices and service were fine, too - it was a pleasant and unhurried meal looking out towards the capitol building.

COST: $9.95 (Prime Rib Sandwich) $4.95 (Matchstick Fries) $8.95 (Mac & Cheese) $5 (Kessler's Old Fashioned IN A PINT)  Coming from Los Angeles and then Chicago, this place was heaven. The food and drinks were delicious and the prices are unbeatable. Definitely got spoiled here over a weekend trip and it would pain me to pay higher prices now that I'm back in Chicago.  Madison and this place are just too awesome for words. The ambiance and service were great.   The sandwich and fries were amazing as was the cheesy goodness of their Mac & Cheese. One would hope they'd nail their cheese seeing as I was in Wisconsin and that they did.  My favorite is definitely the $5 pint of hard liquor. I mean come on!

Yes, yes, yes - I hereby declare that no foodie's trip to Madison, WI is complete without an obligatory stop at the Old Fashioned. 2 pairs of sisters decided to grab a late dinner and were quoted an agreeable wait time of 45 minutes. We tried to find a spot to grab a drink before dinner but our plans were follied by short bursts of heavy rain showers. We returned to the restaurant and sat at the bar while we sipped on some libations. The cherry old fashioned drink was a bit of a letdown, as I was expecting a more smoothly crafted drink. Rather, I could taste the individual ingredients and felt that it lacked a smooth finish.   After we were seated, we ordered a round of cheese curds. Everyone should order these! Fresh cheese curds, lightly battered and fired to perfection served with an excellent complement of creamy mildly horseradish sauce! I was very tempted to order a second round.... Each of us also ordered a burger and no one was disappointed :) The meat to bun ratio was on point and all of the accoutrements only added to the Wisconsin meat and dairy nirvana. I tried another beverage - a seasonal martini with a blueberry flavor but was not impressed. That being said, I will gladly drive over from Chicago over and over again for the excellent food and keep trying out different old fashioned cocktails until I find my favorite.

Each of the three times I went, the drinks were nothing special and the food was average to passable, yes, even the cheese curds. Nothing about this place stood out for me to make me want to make it a regular haunt. And when you've gone to a place three times and each time was uninteresting, why go back again for a fourth time?

The bar tender helped me navigate the extensive beer menu. All his choices were great. I also ordered cheese curd (with the paprika sauce), beer cheddar soup, and the wurst platter. The wurst platter is the best, the fried cheese curds are out of this world, and the soup is very... Cheesy. I may not get the soup again, but I will certainly go back given the chance. Absolutely great food, great atmosphere, and the bar tenders know their brews.

Came here in the middle of a road trip. I wanted to experience something quintessentially Wisconsin, and Yelp led me in the direction of The Old Fashioned. The food was really good, the decor was supper club classy and the beer was local and tasty. We went on a Monday before 5, which meant crazy deals. 2 for 1 beer and burgers meant we saved a lot of money. The cheese curds made me a little queasy, but that's only because they tasted so good that I didn't stop when I should have.

This was our first stop of the day. Really wanted to try an old fashioned but felt it too early in the day. ("Too early?" WTF??? I know!) Went with a mimosa instead and that hit the spot.   I heard the cheese curds here were the best, so had to try them of course. What I heard turned out to be true. Effin delicious! Probably not the healthiest way to start a day, but who cares!   Had the breakfast sandwich too. English muffin was much more dense than I expected but it was really good. The egg was perfectly cooked and when the yolk broke all over, what a delicious mess that ended up being.   Next time, an old fashioned for me. And please, more cheese curds!

"Stately and pleasantly it sat, A compact house and strong. Then I went in: The door of it was hung beef, the threshold was dry bread,  cheese-curds the walls." -12th Century Traditional Celtic Song.  Who knew that cheese curds were musical? I had a hunch, but, until last night, I hadn't had the opportunity to sing their song. They are squeaky balls of fried goodness that locals may take for granted, but this chronic traveler is freakin excited about them. If you wanna devirginize your curdishness, please do it at Madison's The Old Fashioned. That they are just a side dish to a full menu of amazing food and drink is a bonus.  A production of Madama Butterfly brought me to Madison, and The Old Fashioned was recommended to me by many locals. So a few colleagues and I ventured over from our place nearby on Capitol Square, on a frigid, snow-flurrying Sunday evening.   The menu is fairly big, but unlike some of the major pubfood-make-a-pig of-yourself-chains, each item on this local gem's menu seemed to relate somehow to each other. It was as if you could choose any three things from the menu, in any combo, and have a great meal.  After a pal and I shared the fried cheese curds and stopped crying from the pleasure, I chose the Old Fashioned Burger. It was perfectly done, and crowned with a delicious fried egg. The gooey yolk (called dippy eggs where I come from) mixed with the "garlic sauce" on the burger. Is it sad that I could have eaten two of these? My colleagues had the Scandavian Chicken dinner and the salmon salad. Perhaps the chicken was a little dry, but it was such a generous, fresh portion that you found a way to adjust your taste buds to enjoy the dryness. It's sorta like pretending to enjoy the taste of shrooms when preparing to trip out on them. The payoff is worth it.  This was all chased with a New Glarus Organic Revolution, which was on tap for $2.50 a pint (what?) and a piece of the apple pie with aged Wisconsin cheddar on top. When I say a piece, I mean an entire wedge.  I have a few more weeks in Madison, and am looking forward to trying a few other things at the Old Fashioned.  The menu of "lazy susans" really has my attention right now....one with brats and sausages and  deviled eggs...come on.  Squeaky curds-freakishly addictive, like the finest, phattiest herbal blunt, but way cheaper.

If you've never tried the Old Fashioned, you must do so ASAP.  First thing's first: Try the cheese curds. Best you'll ever have. It's not just about the beer battered cheese curds themselves, but about the amazing dipping sauce that comes with them. Simply awesome.  Everything I've ever gotten there was really good and quite reasonably priced. Good size portions that will either fill you up and/or leave you with a to-go box.  I'm not much of a drinker, so I can't really say anything about their bar. However, from the looks of it, it seems to be well stocked with a variety of alcohol to meet everyone's drinking needs.  The only possible downside to The Old Fashioned is the wait. Often there is a bit of a wait to be seated. I've only had to wait 15 minutes or so, but I've only ever gone at lunch time. I'm assuming dinner could get pretty crazy.  If your looking for a good place that serves an awesome burger/salad/sandwhich and some KILLER cheese curds, look no further.

The old fashioned here is very special (well since it's in the restaurant name) and truly delicious. They crush an orange peel and cherry together with the sugar and bitter, which is kinda unique from all the old fashioned recipes I tried online. It's a little sweet but I really like it!! The hot dog is delicious too, with the true texture of meat (not some lousy starchy flavor). We also ordered onion rings and cheese curds, portion size is very Wisconsin. My second favorite American restaurant in Madison!

It's always super busy, but that's because it has everything you could want in a Wisconsin themed restaurant! I would recommend going for a drink with a group and ordering one of the lazy susans and some cheese curds.
Classic Wisconsin fare and one that should not be missed if you're in town visiting.  Wait times can be long for dinner, so be prepared.

Def the best place you will find near the confines of the Capitol building. Great beer selection. Lively place. The wait was going to be 25mins but we were texted ( I like the text feature ) by the hostess in just a few minutes. The cheese curds were really amazing, some of the best curds I have in dairy land. Service was great. The only reason for the 4 instead of 5 is I wasnt crazy about the Walleye sandwich. It was good but maybe just too much batter and bread or me, I ended up taking it apart to pick at the meat. That said, everything else looked great around us and I would definitely come back to try other menu items.   Great place!

Phenomenal food at phenomenal prices. Their salads were large and cheap, fried cheese curds were fantastic as was their beer cheese soup. The sandwiches my friends got were also great.  Don't leave Madison without going to the Old Fashioned!

Nice atmosphere, very mediocre food. Indifferent wait staff. Don't get the vegetable sandwich, it is very bland. Beer cheese soup was okay and cheese curds were ok. Pulled pork was just pulled pork, no special flavor, really not much for flavor in general.

Very popular and does not take reservations. Tried for lunch yesterday (90 minute wait), dinner (ditto) before finally getting in today for breakfast. Food was good and different. I had walleye and eggs! Vegetarian options available. Service was really slow despite the restaurant not being that busy.

The CHEESE CURDS. Given that this is what they're famous for, I expected them to be pretty good, but they exceeded my expectations. Better than cheese curds I've had at other Madison restaurants!  My main dish of Fish & Chips was unfortunately not as spectacular. While certainly not a bad dish, it fell a little short after the delicious cheese curds.  Overall, my experience was good though! I would advise coming at odd times, since it gets RIDICULOUSLY crowded after 5:30 PM. It's certainly a famous place for a reason.

This place is always packed.  The food is always amazing and the portions are on the heavy side.  The staff and bartenders are very friendly and knowledgeable.  They seem to do a good job of retaining good quality staff.  This establishment is also gay owned and very gay friendly.    The Old Fashioned is always packed and you should expect a (worth while) wait most nights.  You cannot make reservations but they do have a high tech waiting list that will text you when your table is ready and tell you how many people are ahead of you.  I've never waited more than 45 minutes even with larger groups.

My favorite place to "drink." I don't care too much about the food. But their "Bourbon Old Fashioned" is fantabulous. Also, unlike a lot of state street places, the place is much more for grown ups. The bar has nice thick wood counter, the bartenders are professional and they do know how to mix good drinks.   Friday nights gets crazy busy, but Tuesday / Wednesday late nights are more manageable and relaxing.

I've been to the old fashioned a few times and each time is... meh... obviously great beer selection, but that's really about it. Waiting 45 minutes for subpar service and food isn't my thing.   One time we were given a 45 minute wait time, sure, that's fine.. we were seated, and waited another 10 for our server to arrive. Communication issue? Understaffed? Forgot about us? Not sure.. but not impressed.   Cheese curds are decent but in entirety, not my cup of tea when it comes to comfort food.   I may give it another shot, but wouldn't recommend it to others.
One of my favorite restaurants in Madison. Old fashions and cheese curds will always taste like home.

This was good, but not great.  Lots of local beers to choose from, which is probably why it normally gets better reviews.  For people from out of town it was a neat local eatery, but nothing real memorable. It was loud, which was nice with our kids.  Kids menu was decent.  Spicy burger was ok - it was so hot at some point I couldn't really taste the flavor anymore. My husband did like the walleye sandwich.

This place was a flavor explosion in my mouth! The cheese curds were a gooey testament to the state's greatest product. I could have just eaten those. I also ordered the House Old Fashioned burger. The egg on top was cooked to perfection. The perfection of the gooey flavors is impossible  to describe. If I am ever in Madison again, I would try to swing in here.

One of my (and many other people's) favorite places in Madison! I'm a huge fan of a good old fashioned and true to their name & claim - they make a great one. Great beer selection as well and I have seen them run night specials on specific craft beers a few times already, which is a nice way to try something new. I've only dined here 2 or 3 times and every time I get a burger but I've never been disappointed and I think the beef is local which is always nice. Of course, the cheese curds are highly recommended but we all already know that ;P.   Oh, I have yet to not have seen them be super busy, even on a weeknight evening & they do not take reservations. Something to keep in mind if you would like to sit down and eat dinner here!

This place and its environ always, always, always smells like charcuterie. If that sounds appealing (or just tolerable as in my case), then proceed. The portions are comically large, and they have all the classic Wisconsin-y foods. Their cheese curds are probably the best of the fancy friend cheese curds in Madison (get the Tiger Sauce). If you're into beer, this is a good spot. They also have an entire menu of Old Fashioneds, including a slushy one. Kind of fun to bring tourists. I enjoy their take on Eggs Benedict, the Wisconsin Benedict, for brunch--believe me the single is more than enough for one! The hidden gem is their weekday breakfast menu (7:30 am - 11 am). It's enough to make you want to wake up that much earlier before work.

While a slightly more upscale, supper club inspired concept would typically perk up the skeptic inside of me (he's a hulking beast with a sinister villain-esque handlebar mustache with his head eternally cocked to the side and one eye brow raised higher than the other), this place does it right on pretty much every level.  A wonderful ode to the state, their focus is simple: respect the rich traditions of the food that makes Wisconsin unique, in an environment that is equal parts welcoming and casual, and put it all together with a high level of service.  The menu, while large, was basically broken down mainly into some appetizers, sandwiches, and a few nightly specials.  What was impressive was the care taken to ensure that every menu item highlighted something that was Sconnie-specific.  The beer list alone makes me want to head on back to try a few that aren't distributed here in Illinois yet.  A great setting right across from the capital building, with a nice concept to pay homage to the great state of Wisconsin, The Old Fashioned is a must visit when in Madison.

Cheese curds were amazing! Very filling too. We order egg scramble. I really like the egg. I swear the texture is different than most eggs. My fianc, however, enjoyed the potato that came with more. He was amazed by how good potato could taste. Had a glass of mimosa. Tasty and must have for Saturday brunch! I had a veggie sandwich. Yummy! Lots of flavors in it. I added some spicy sauce in it, which made everything even better. Great service as well. Great place!

Great beer selection, kind and energetic staff, and awesome atmosphere make this one of Madison's great bars!  I've had many great experiences for breakfast, lunch and dinner, and even had a nice date at the Old Fashioned.

Visiting from SF Bay, in early April, I suffered from the bland starchiness pervasive in Wisconsin food.  TOF made it all worth it and actually made me feel like I get ripped off in CA far too often.  With beers, I discovered the $1 snacks- pickled egg, jowl, a bunch of other stuff I can't remember.  Salty, vinegary, fatty, and adventurous; perfect match to my beers. For lunch, that burger bomb with grilled onions, cheese, and egg on top really put me over the edge.  I knew it was all fat so I picked the salad to go with it.  Didn't miss a single fry.   The bloody mary was the best I've ever had.  My pregnant wife had it virgin and I didn't miss a thing.  There's homemade pickled good thingsf in that one, too; very well made.   In a place where serving local food seems difficult, they made it seem dumb not to.  A similar experience in CA would go for twice the price.

This is the first place anyone takes you when you visit Madison. There is more history in here than any other establishment in town and perhaps the state, depending on how much emphasis you place on dive bars near the stadium in Green Bay.   It is always packed and noisy. The staff is overworked but the few times I have visited I have found that they always do what is needed if little else. They don't have the time to explain what kind of artisanal swine is used in the summer sausage. You don't mind so much, unless you are a true moron who doesn't have any sense of context, because it is always packed.   Oh, and you also don't mind because you're enjoying a wurst plate or a double bratwurst. Everything is homemade and fresh and best of kind. If it isn't, they aren't serving it. And people around you are laughing and having fun. And isn't that what matters? Everyone goes there because it's a great place to be.   If you want to quiz the server about the GMO levels of the milk used to form the cheese curds, there's a snooty place around the square where they are too happy to curate their menu. That place was weird and boring. So when you friend or family member suggests that you go to the Old Fashioned, expect kind of a party. And have fun.

I've heard raving reviews about The Old Fashioned prior to my trip to Madison and I was looking forward to our meal when we arrived early and still had to wait for a table. My expectations for this place were high and I was disappointed in the food and service.  Our server was not friendly and when we paid with cash, she shortchanged us! Unbelievable.  Additionally, the cheese curds were soggy from being completely soaked in oil and the fish and chips were over battered with more batter than fish. They do have a good variety of beers, so I would stick to The Old Fashioned for drinks only, in which case, don't wait for a table.

Juicy burgers made with excellent quality beef!  We went at 3:30 pm prior to a Badger Basketball game at 6 and they were very, very busy.  Choose your time for a visit wisely and the food will reward you.  Chili, beer soup and cheese curds all well above average.  Enjoy!

Had a great dinner and drinks with friends. Of course you have to have an Old Fashion, which was delicious, if you are there. First time I had a burger with a egg, which was also delicious. Make reservations if you can because it is a popular place, especially if college is in session. We didn't and waited about 45 minutes which was fine as we enjoyed the bar area. Would definitely come back here!!
Great old fashion beverage, pretty tasty sandwich- chicken bacon something. Bacon was not crispy the sandwich! It was a big let down... limp almost soggy bacon.  Will return though!
The service was great, the food was amazing! Heirloom tomato BLT and locally grown sweet corn. Wonderful!

OF has been a long-time favorite for all my family & friends and it is our default place for most holidays/celebrations. I've never had a mediocre experience there. The staff is always awesome and their Brandy Slush is the best thing ever.

Let's start with the good. My steak was cooked ok. I ordered medium rare but it was more medium well. Not the end of the world. However, this place was freezing cold and had terrible service. We asked to move several times but the hostess did not care and would not move our table. Our appetizer and food took a long time to arrive. The whole dinner event took about 2 hours and that was after being seated right away.  This place is also terribly overpriced. For a steak the only side option I had was fries. That's fine but don't charge $30 for basically a small piece of meat. If I wanted to pay that I'd go to a fancy establishment like the Mason Street Grille. But I didn't, this place is a bar atmosphere. Overall it's bad service, overpriced, typical Madison bs.

I'm not a beer connoisseur, but I have loved everything I've tried here.  And the burgers...guys, they are unreal.  I've had dreams (good ones) about the Old Fashioned House Burger.  That fried egg really does it.  Service is great and very Wisconsin-friendly.  Even at 7pm on a Saturday night, when you're told the wait will be an hour to an hour and 15 minutes, you're usually seated within 45 max.  And in the meantime, drinking delicious beer at the bar is definitely not a bad alternative.

I was really happy that they quickly found a place for our group of ten or twelve ona  Friday night, and the servers were really friendly. There was a pretty decent selection of beer, but I wasn't too into the "build your own old fashioned" concept, although drinks with a pickled egg or brussel sprouts were quite intriguing, as does the food, so maybe I just went the wrong direction.
Old fashioned deserves this 5 star rating for the food, ambiance and service.  I had a really fantastic meal there on Tuesday evening.

The night didn't start off well at the old fashioned.  We had a 1.5 to 2 hour waiting time.  The restaurant calls your table by texting your cell phone.  For some odd reason they (the restaurant) could not get the message to send to us.  After waiting for about 1.5 hours for our table I decided to go check how long it would be before our number was called.  They had bypassed us because of the cell phone problem.  After we were finally seated we order a few beers which were great.  We also ordered the bratwurst appetizer which was amazing.  For my main course I had the bacon Mac and cheese and it was terrific.  Minus having that little mess up with our table not getting called everything else tasted so great.  Suggest to everyone to try this place out but recommend going on a less busy night.  The university of Wisconsin was having family weekend that night.  Great food though!!!!!!

A terrific find in the locavore vein, recommended to us by multiple locals when we tried to find a place to have lunch on Sunday before leaving to come home to NYC.    The menu is chockablock with regional dishes with locally produced ingredients, many artisanal and delicious.  Peter asked to have an item on the regular menu (Wisconsin's Best Wurst Platter) when they were only serving brunch and they were happy to oblige him.  Service was terrific--knowledgeable, friendly and well-informed.  I had a bloody mary that was slighly less good than the one I had at Smoky's the night before, but also came with a PBR chaser.  Peter had an Oktoberfest brew from the New Glaurus brewery which turns out some of the best beers I have ever had.   Peter was dying for brats and sausage, being in Wisconsin, and the selection offered did not disappoint.  Bavaria Sausage Kitchen's Nuremberg knockwurst, bratwurst and weisswurst were grilled to perfection, and served with two regional mustards, sauerkraut and grilled country bread.  I ordered the House burger, of local beef, sauteed onions, Bavaria's house-cured bacon, local cheddar, garlic sauce and a fried egg on a toasted Kaiser roll that had the DOUGH PULLED OUT over where the egg needed to go, so that the yolk would only break when you wanted it to.  It came with rosemary potatoes, which are new red bliss quarters that are battered, seasoned and fried.  Not overly greasy, they were light and fluffy and fully of potato flavor.  It was quite simply the best burger I have ever eaten, bar none.  So fresh, so delicious and so well balanced that I haven't stopped thinking about it since I left Wisconsin.  We finished with cheese plate number 4, which changes according to availability, but ours had a sheeps' milk Camembert style, a 15-year-aged cheddar style and a pecorino.  They came with walnuts, granny smith apple slices and local honey, and were the perfect way to end the meal.  Coffee was terrific too.  One of the best finds in the area.  If you love food, eat here.

Love the theme of this restaurant, couldn't ask for a better location, and the name "Old Fashioned" just screams Wisconsin!  It's s place you see and what to check out.  Tonight I decided to try the "Green Bay" Chili and the Sheboygan Brat Sandwich.  Which is really weird because i'm from the Green Bay/Sheboygan Area. (I must have missed home tonight!)   The brats were done well and were tasty, came with lots of fresh raw onions, but the bun was not as good as some of the real Sheboygan Rolls I have had in the past.  I would still recommend this sandwich... it was pretty good!    The part I would skip is the Green Bay Chili.  I'm assuming the "Green Bay" part is the fact that it had spaghetti noodles. Here's where I feel the hometown snobbery comes in,  this is no GB Chili!  I would have to guess that this is a canned Chili that is doctored with spaghetti.  More like Hormel, less like homemade.  If you want good Green Bay Chili drive 3 hours north to Kroll's (next to Lambeau).  Your welcome!  As far as The Old Fashioned, come and enjoy the great drinks,cheese curds or haystack onions, but skip the Chilli.

This is the first place I recommend to people coming to Madison for the first time!   Beer menu is extensive and features about 50 on tap and even more in bottles.  Cheese curds are fantastic. Get them with tiger sauce on the side.  One of my favorite places in town to get Mac and Cheese (and if you ask, they'll add it as a side to your entree even though it's not an option on the menu).  The service has always been great each time I've been here. The restaurant does not take reservations and is first-come, first-served, so prepare to wait if you come during a busy time.

the long waits are a bore! A pretty packed and loud place to eat/drink. I good place for a dinner/drinks out with friends. not a romantic place for dinner with your sig other. It also sucks that you have to wait until your whole party is in attendance before they will seat you. 8 of us had to wait until the 9th person showed up to join us, and there was no room to even grab a drink while we waited. the restaurant would have made a lot more money from us if we were able to get a table and order drinks and apps while we waited for our + 1.

I tried the walleye sandwich for the second time last night and it is a sandwich to be recognized. The only thing wrong with it is that it is, somehow, too big. But believe me when I say I will try to eat the whole thing every time.  My significant other ordered the house burger, which was delicious as well . We have been here in the past and tried specials, cheese plates and lazy susans.  While nothing has been bad (I was impressed with their cheese platters especially) I have yet to have anything that is equally as delightful as the walleye sandwich.   I highly recommend the Old Fashioned for dinner or drinks. It offers a casual atmosphere and a great location on the square.

Super impressed with this place. Was in Madison on a business trip and always scope out local places and this time we found this gem. Beer selection was unheard of, a coworker got a flight and it was served very stylish. I stuck with the theme of the restaurant and got a traditional old fashioned and it went down soo smooth. And for $6 a drink I wasn't sad when I went to order my 4th because I didn't feel robbed.  The drink was best old fashioned I've ever had. Seriously.  We aye dinner too and that was equally impressive. Got a burger, great beef and the GF bun actually tasted like a real bun. Wasn't missing anything. The portion was huge and the price tag awesome. If you want some good hearty food and heart warming drinks this is your place!

I just moved here from out of state (grew up near nyc), and after living here for a few months I've decided this is one of my favorite restaurants in Madison. There's a few reasons why:  1. I'll start off with the fact that this place has far-and-away the best cheese curds I've tasted yet. Granted I'm not a Wisconsin native, but I can appreciate good food when I see it. The Old Fashioned's curds are the tastiest, gooiest, squeakiest, and have the best texture of anywhere else I've been. They're a must-have, hands down.  2. The atmosphere is perfect. It's the kind of place where you can feel comfortable in anything from a shirt and tie to a t-shirt and shorts. It has this rustic, busy feeling that feels both modern and, well, old fashioned. The energy in the place is always happy, probably attributable to point #1.  3. The beer. I hear their cocktails are great too, but I haven't actually had them. I have, on the other hand, had several 12-snit beer flights there and I can safely say I've tasted everything they have on tap. The biggest thing is that their selection is almost entirely Wisconsin-local beers. I love that, even though (and maybe especially because) I'm from out of state. Their presentation (on giant slabs of wood) for the beer flights is pretty awesome, too.  4. The food I've had there is the only thing I might hesitate on for the 5-star rating (I'd have preferred to give a 4.5). I love their Wurst Platter (which can easily feed 3 people for about $15), and some of their burgers are very good, but I've found the food to be extremely rich and hard to take more than a few bites of. If you're into that, right on. I have a little trouble getting through meals, though. Lots of food for relatively inexpensive cost.   5. Everything else, like the service and the outdoor seating and the text system for getting a table. All outstanding.

If I only had time for one meal in Madison, I would spend it at The Old Fashioned. Situated downtown right across from the Capitol, the location is convenient, and it's nice strolling around the square with that view during the inevitable wait.  As for the food, what you'll find are the things Wisconsin is known for and also lots of comfort food and classics. They have burgers and meats grilled over a live fire. They have fish fry on Wednesdays and Fridays. They have lots of local ingredients. And their housemade fresh Wisconsin beer-battered cheese curds are the best cheese curds I've ever had.  The first time we went we got a basket of cheese curds ($8) for our group, and by our next visit a few days later, we had already upped that to a basket of cheese curds for every couple of people. They were that good. Incredibly cheesy but somehow not that heavy, and they didn't even need any of the sauces that came with them. I don't know what they do to them, but the flavor was just better than any other cheese curds I had while we were in Madison. It was so tempting to order more baskets but we knew we'd be full off the other food.  I initially planned to get a burger on our first visit, but couldn't pass up a chance to try the bratwurst ($9), made locally in Sheboygan and served with raw onions, pickles, and brown mustard on a roll with a side of fries. That was some good bratwurst, and I was very happy with my decision. It all worked well as a combination, and the portion of matchstick fries was so huge that I was so full when we left. I couldn't believe all that only cost $9, but the prices at The Old Fashioned are really reasonable.  On another visit, we went on Wednesday so we could try the traditional fish fry ($14). They only do lake perch on Wednesday, but if you go on Friday, you can get perch, cod, or walleye, or all three. (We did try to go for Friday fish fry another time, but sadly it was the day they were closed from the fire.) I was pretty happy with the lake perch, which was easily double the portion size I was expecting, and some of the best fried fish I've had. It came with the same fries as everything else, some housemade tartar sauce, cole slaw, and rye bread, all of which were good. Would definitely do that again.  If you're looking for affordable food downtown and want to try some of the stuff Wisconsin is known for (cheese, brats, beer, fish fry, etc), The Old Fashioned is an excellent choice. Friendly staff, good food, casual atmosphere, pretty much everything we were looking for.
The BEST cheese curds, great beer selection and location right by the capitol, and they make a mean Old Fashioned....a must-stop when in Madison.

This place has NEVER disappointed me!  It's high quality, good old fashioned comfort food in an incredibly comfortable setting. No matter what you decide to order, you really can't go wrong, but if I were to recommend anything it would be the Beer-battered Walleye Sandwich, it is OUT OF THIS WORLD! Every bite has the perfect combination of flavors, I have no idea how they do it.  The cheese curds are also amazing and you must have an old fashioned. I prefer a brandy old fashioned sweet.
Fantastic curds. After sampling several all over Madison, this place had the best in town. Never had an actual old fashioned, but if they're like these, they're great.

The Old Fashioned is a classic of Madison, so I was told. Naturally, I had to check it out when I visited. The prices are a little high, but the quality of the food makes up for it. The wait staff was not the most attentive at all times. Overall, I would suggest you visit The Old Fashioned if you are visiting Madison.

Nothing says "Welcome to Wisconsin" like beer, brats and cheese curds...and The Old Fashioned does it all well!  We were visiting Madison and found the Old Fashioned, right across from the Capitol.   There was a short wait but we scored two seats at the bar and the bartender offered to serve us as well, which was perfect as seating is very tight in the dining rooms.  We started with bloody Mary's which were a meal in themselves--including beef jerkey and served with a shot of beer.  Who doesn't love Mimosas that are served in beer glasses???? Previous Yelpers had raved about the deep fried cheese curds and boy, were they right.  The Tiger  sauce is to.die.for.  My husband had the brat which was enough for two and I had the prime rib sandwich, which was a little salty but excellent none the less! We saw quite a few breakfast/brunch offerings being served and they looked delicious as well.  Portions are large and very reasonably priced..A large beer list with local rotators and solid service make the Old Fashioned a great choice for breakfast, lunch or dinner!

I found myself here again on a Friday looking for something that'll satisfy my belly after a long week at work and on a cold gloomy day. New England Clam Chowder...I think yes. I also went for the spicy burger this time needing to turn up the heat. And the it did the trickn with jalapenos, papperjack cheese and whatever else was causing the fire in my mouth had me asking for refills. Almost everything on their menu is delish. You can't go wrong.  http://www.getnmahbelly.com/2012/03/the-old-fashioned-big-wisconsin-flavor/

Its all in the name here! The old fashioned is absolutely the best place in Madison to get... you guessed it; and Old Fashion. They have a drink menu dedicated to just Old Fashions from brandy, whisky, rum, etc. Whatever liquor you prefer in your drink they can do it.  I particularly like there orange rum twist they have on the drink.   Fun here is also good, there cheese curds are awesome. Overall a good Madison Wisconsin staple.
Best breakfast! Love the No. 10! Yum!! I love the outside seating, it's perfect for people watching on the square.

I know it was you, Fredo. You broke my heart. You broke my heart!  This review is a really tough one to write.  I used love the Old Fashioned.  Hunka hunka burnin' love sort of love  But then you changed and broke my heart (sob).  In the beginning, it was oh so magical.  In the days before 45 minutes wait times, the service was impeccable, the food sublime and ambiance alluring.  You were great at so many things: lunch with a co-worker, dinner with the kids, a late night bite with my better half.  But as you became more popular, things stated to slip.  The servers became less attentive as they dealt with the never ending throng of customers.  Not only did it take longer to be seated, but it was taking longer and longer to get the food I ordered, get refills on drinks or get the check when I needed to rush out to get to a show.  Then here was that time when my table was plagued by a swarm of flies (think Amityville Horror).  When the server joked about the problems instead of taking care of it, I knew the time had come for The Old Fashioned to sleep with the fishes.  And about the food...it has slipped as well.  Back in the day, the allure of those piping hot fried cheese curds could have launched a 1,000 ships.  Now, more ofthen than not, the arrive at the table greasy and lukewarm.  Ditto for the haystack onion rings.  The allure of the grilled cheese sandwich also faded as the bacon would show up undercooked or they chef would skimp on the roasted red peppers (horror of horrors)   While nearby restaurant like Graze, Nostrano and Osteria Papavero continue to innovate and improve, you seem content to rest on your laurels.  So I hate to say it, but Fredo, you're nothing to me now. You're not a brother, you're not a friend. I don't want to know you or what you do.

The Old Fashioned is the place I go when I am entertaining out-of-town guests, otherwise I tend to shy away from it (and most of the other establishments on the square). However, this past week, after dinner with some friends on the square, we decided to stop by The Old Fashioned to have a drink and to try the cheese curds (so that we could settle the old debate of who had the better cheese curds: Graze or The Old Fashioned?)  The wait was long because they were clearing out tables and setting up for karaoke ( FYI: Wednesday night is apparently karaoke night, for those of you wanting to indulge in some drunken classics), but we were told that we could order from the kitchen at the bar, and we were welcome to any spots that we could find. Luckily, we found a row of chairs enough to fit our party at the back of the bar!  The bartenders are friendly and attentive, always managing to somehow fill our water cups even on a very busy evening. Impressive! My friend had the original Old Fashioned (of course), and I had the House Brew. We all shared a basket of cheese curds.  The House Brew was much darker and heavier than I expected. I thought the house brew would be a pale ale, but it was almost dark enough to be a lager. It was delicious though - really rich and nutty, almost like Guinness. I also thought the Old Fashioned was pretty good, although sweeter than I would have expected.   Finally, the verdict on the cheese curds? (Drum rollllllllll) We had to give Graze the crown. Although the cheese curds at The Old Fashioned are great, they aren't as battered or as crunchy as the ones at Graze, which we all agreed was what really made them shine.  Til next time!
Piling on, it is good. Chhesecurds be great! Elbow to Elbow sucks but it is Mad city downtown

This was my first trip to Madison (and Wisconsin in general) and I went here for dinner as recommended by the hotel.  GREAT selection of Wisconsin beers and cheeses and a good choice if you're looking for something classically Wisconsin.  After tasting about 7 beers, I settled on the New Glarus Totally Naked.  Went well with my spinach salad, which in turn didn't make me feel so bad about the fried cheese curds.  Man, I am so glad they don't have those in Colorado!  It would be bad news for me (if you haven't guessed, they're a-ma-zing!).  Definitely would come again.

The service was incredibly slow for a weekday brunch. We waited about 20 mins for our waiter to pick up our checks. A server also spilled jelly everywhere and did not alert me that it sprayed all over my back. Not sure if I'll visit again.
Burger was over cooked and over seasoned. Drinks were solid along with curds. Sat us by the front door and we froze while eating also. I'd say an average overall experience.

The first few times I went to the Old Fashioned, I absolutely loved it. The cheese curds were fresh and at the perfect temperature and coupled with the smoked paprika sauce... Let's just say I still dream about them sometimes.  The burger with the egg is also hands down my favorite burger in the world. You just can't beat it.  I've also gotten the salmon salad and another salad that had a warm, bacon dressing as well as other things that made it really unhealthy. The exact names of both escape me but seeing as there are only like 4 salad entrees on the menu, they're not hard to find. I would definitely recommend both.  But I do have to dock a star. They don't take reservations which can lead to a frustrating 30-40 minute wait and I feel that as the restaurant has gotten more popular, the quality has gone down. The last time I went the cheese curds were super oily and soggy. I know that cheese curds aren't healthy by any means, but at least in the past I wasn't reminded of that fact with the (small) pockets of oil lingering on the curds and how the pieces were all stuck together.

This place always has a line and a wait. I have no idea why! The food is like fair food. Always greasy and fatty. It's cheap! I guess that's why it's always busy. I leave here feeling sick every time. Don't think I'll be back.

This was a great place to stop. The cheese curds were worth the trip. Also if you're from an easy coast city you'll find the prices quite cheap compared to the Northeast. I had the old fashioned burger and it was excellent. It was cooked medium rare as desired. I had the error Wisconsin whiskey flight and I don't think it was in order of lower to higher proof which is there reason I heavier it 4 stars. Service was great!

As a first time visitor to the lovely city of Madison, WI my tour guides took us to all the classics.  Which of course included The Old Fashioned.  We were not able to eat and get a table here due to the enormous wait, but we did get to sit at the bar and have a few bloody marys (That included jerky, pickle spears, cheese curds, pickled eggs....)  so it was basically a full and salty meal.  Their cocktail menu for the non-bloody lovers did not seem as thought out or as good brunch options.  They also infuse their own vodka with a variety of hot peppers.  After a round of shots with the bartender -- can't remember his name but he was fantastic -- we were ready to go seize the day!

Great place to have dinner if you're in the neighborhood. This place doesn't take ressies which is a bummer but they were able to accommodate us fairly quickly. I had a great time here. Food and drinks were good and service was great. I had their old fashioned (of course), bloody mary and their cherry ale. As for food, we got the bacon mac & cheese, fish fry, beef jerky, sausage platter and fried cheese curds. Everything was great. I especially liked the curds! A must!
I just love everything about TOF. The food...amazing! Drinks....amazing! And it's not over priced. One of my all time favorites!

Nice joint located literally across from the capital building/ you can't miss it!  Inside, it's pretty vintage with a beautiful old bar with tons of nooks, huge ancient WORN bar top, old plank wood floors & many tables for diners.  First off, the draft list is outstanding.. heavy on local beers and they had more than 50 brews on draught!  Everything from PBR to New Glarus they only pack Wisconsin beers.  Large food menu as well and they are known for their cheese curds with paprika sauce.. MUST TRY!  Always busy and seems to be popular with the tourists..-1 for that.  Great stop for a few cold ones & some curds. Talk Later

Great location and energetic atmosphere, but really just average for food.  Too much of their menu is fried and nothing really stands out for me.  People do rave about the cheese curds, but they are often on the greasy side for me.  Good selection of beers and better than average for bar food, but they are just average compared to many other places downtown.

I've had my fair share of visits to this place, I like to sit downstairs at the bar. If you're lookin' for a table, they have seating upstairs and some of the tables have a really nice view of the square. Which is where I've say each time I've came for dinner.   Food quality is good, but nothing that blows my mind. Their cheese curds are pretty darn tasty, so I tend to go for drinks and curds if I'm headed to the Old Fashioned.
Great place to go when your family visits. Really good appetizer trays full of German goodness.

Never any better choice if you want a good Sconnie meal. The Old Fashioned is one of the things I miss most about Wisconsin after moving to New Orleans. HUGE tap beer selection, amazing fish fry, heavy, heavy food. Delicious, unique meals, made with local products whose origins are told right there on the menu.  The only tidbit I've learned that disappointed me slightly was that the fries are from bags in the freezer, but they are still delicious, especially when you add their Spanish paprika sauce. Still, gotta go with cheese curds from the Old Fashioned, right?  Some recommendations are:  Everything

I rescind my previous review. Whatever kinks with food and service existed when the Old Fashioned opened no longer exist.  The walleye fish fry is the best in town. (and so are the aforementioned cheese curds.) You must take out of townies here.

This is our go-to spot in the Capitol neighborhood if we aren't feeling anything specific like seafood or steaks or something like that.   The food is ridiculously inexpensive, tastes great, and is always about twice too much to eat at once.   In the evenings there can be a fairly long wait, but you can download an app to get constant updates on your place in line. Go find a drink and hang out - enjoy the people watching!  We like to sit at the bar and watch baseball if it's in season - they'll always put the Brewers on for you if there isn't something more nationally relevant on (NBA or NHL Finals, or something like that). The bartenders are friendly and will always talk if they aren't too busy making Old Fashioneds.   It's not fancy, it isn't pretentious, it isn't expensive. It's Wisconsin. Bring your out of town friends here at least once.

Other than ordering from the bar being a bit of a pain for a full sized restaurant we had a great lunch here! Super beef jerky, yummy greens and tuna salad. Great Bloody Mary with tasty pickles! Walleye sandwich so-so, good kids meals.

I was told this place is a staple in Madison. It's easy to see why given the ambiance, but the food just wasn't that impressive.  Had the #30 house burger with cheese curds. The garlic sauce was awesome, but there were way too many onions and the burger itself was a little overcooked and definitely underseasoned. The cheddar, bacon, and egg were egg-cellent toppings.  The cheese curds seemed like they'd been sitting under a heat lamp for a little too long. Not quite crispy, not quite hot, and really just not that interesting.  Next!
Favorite place in town. Love the salads and burgers. Great service. And the best deals on the square. Definitely worth the wait on the weekend. You'll thank me later.

Loved The Old Fashioned. It's perfectly situated right by the Capitol so you have a great view when you're dining. Not far from campus at all, my friend and I went there for lunch and got burgers and fries. They had a great variety of burgers to choose from, including build your own, and they were delicious! Not only did they taste good, the atmosphere was warm and inviting, and it was pretty inexpensive. Would recommend for lunch rather than dinner because the wait is typically extremely long in the evening. Will definitely head back!
Walleye sandwich is amazing.  So much food and delicious.  Can't go wrong with the name sake for a drink either.  Service was great!

Cute atmosphere and great service. Stopped in to try a Bloody Mary and grab a light lunch. We tried the Green Bay chili and beer cheese soup and split the heirloom tomato BLT! Soup was good not great. Beer cheeses a little watery and chili lacked tomato flavor. The chili was kind of bland needed more flavor. The BLT on the other hand was amazing. The bread was toasted perfectly and the tomato delicious. Would like to come back again to try some other menu options.

I'll keep this one short because this Madison land mark can only be summed up in a few words. Wisconsin Beer (ALL OF THEM), OLD FASHIONS (implied), Cheese Curds (in the heart of WI..this is a must) and classic Friday Fish Fry (as a Northern Wisconsin native I have never felt more at home while staring at the capitol from my dining table). DO IT. NOW.

A really solid spot to bring out of town guests. The menu is almost too big, but lots of Wisconsiny things. The curds are really tasty...salty and just the right crispiness. Not my favorite curds in town, but still high on the list.   Beer offerings are are really good for craft beer lovers. Over 40 on tap. The space layout is a little odd. There are two bar and dining areas. Prices are probably a hair overpriced for what it is, but you're paying for food and drink on capitol square, and it won't break the bank. Service is good to average. It's rare I go here without out-of-town guests because there are more convenient, better spots for food in general, but it's great to show off Wisconsin tavern fare  on the square, the food is solid, and there are lots of other good bars within walking distance to make a night of it. The beer and food menu is big enough that everyone will find something they like.

We visited Madison and were told by locals that this was the place to try the fried cheese curds. Boy were they right!! We were there for the 2 for one cheeseburgers as well. Cheddar of course, and they were perfect. Our first cheese curds ever --were amazingly delicious and we also got the warm potato chips. The chips were quite remarkable as well and I took half home. They were even good the second day! For 50 cents you can get a second dipping  sauce for the curds and that was worth it.  I had a Dreamcycle cocktail which was orangey and yummy. My husband had a couple local IPA and he enjoyed them. They were recommended by the waitress who was very friendly and gracious to us out-of-Towners.

This place is too cool! It is a bar and a diner. Their drink staple is obviously The Old Fashion. My friend got it and loved it. I got a cocktail with elder flower vodka in it-it was delicious. The bartenders were attentive and took the time to chat for a short while when they could.

We really wanted to like this place, but it just wasn't up to snuff.  Before being seated we headed to the bar and had great service at the bar as we waited. We Peru's the menu and we're pretty excited about some of the choices though it's mostly sandwiches with only four entres plus the daily special. One seated, the service was not great. We ordered the prime rib special, the spicy hamburger, A walleye sandwich, and the onion strings appetizer.  This was no better than bar food-at best.  My order also came out wrong on the first attempt. And, subsequently as we were leaving, I had the bar to order an old fashioned. I got a snarky reply from one of the bartenders - not the excellent service I had had before at the bar. All in all, not a great experience.

So I was just going through my bank statements preparing for my IRS audit tomorrow and remembered this place from winter of 2008.  Best Wisconsin deep fried cheese curds I've ever had...and I've had many.  Great Old Fashioned drinks as well. Quality spot for ambiance. Had a great catch up dinner with a friend here as it was snowing. Warm and cozy wood interior. A must go to if you're in Mad Town.
Cheese curds and walleye are my favorite!!!!!!! I usually go to the bar, wait is too long. Always delicious

Stopped by based on reviews while visiting Madison.  Neat atmosphere, great service.  Food and beer were very good.  I had the fried fish sandwich and potato salad - very good sandwich; potato salad was old school with big chunks and saucy, good.  Kids had the burgers; they liked them, I had a couple bites - very tasty beef, the kind you don't even need ketchup or mustard.  Agree with other reviewers in that the cheese curds were the best we've had.  Worth a visit!

I went here with too high of expectations maybe....  I did not care for the old fashioned I had here. It was WAY too sweet.   Ordered the cheese plate - It was literally a plate with 3 small slices of basic, unremarkable cheese. They gave you honey and some type of sauce, nuts and some crunchy pita chips. None of these items complimented each other. Wish I hadn't wasted my money on that. 3 mice could have came by and taken the cheese and I wouldn't have cared.  The wurst platter was good. Each of the three sausages, the mustards. bread and sauerkraut complimented the taste. However, I would have preferred to have at least 1 more variety of bread.  Cheese curds and the accompanying sauces were good.  The mac and cheese was ok. Not special.  I wanted to really like this place but I didn't. Between the food and lacking service, it's probably more of a 1.5 star.
Great experience. Crowded but sat at the bar. Bartender took care of us immediately. Had the Wurst Platter. Great midwestern Madison faire.

My favorite restaurant for out of towners. A true Sconnie experience with food like my Milwaukee grandma used to make. Not any vegetarian choices but a few. The booze is off the hook, especially the mixed drinks. Desserts all have ice cream with them - and why not? Our dairy is the best. Crowded - come early. Surprisingly cheap for downtown. Lots to love.

This is a Madison/Wisconsin must try. If your visiting, it's a great place to try Wisconsin food. From beer cheese soup to cheese curds to Mac & cheese.  Pair your food with an Old Fashioned cocktail.  If your not up for some fried food or cheese, their salads are delish as well.

Just go! Everything was outstanding.  The Sunday night chicken special was unbelievable. Yes order the cheese curds! Of course order a local beer!  I cant say enough good things about this place, its staff and atmosphere.
Really good cheese curds. I had the house burger and it was amazing!!! I mean seriously soooooooo good! Cool vibe!

We stopped here for lunch two weeks ago with my in-laws who were visiting from New York. My father-in-law enjoyed his rueben and our burgers were great. The place was really crowded for a weekday and loud. The service was great...the waiter kept our water glasses full which was great because it was a hot day. My husband enjoyed the wide selection of beer. The only thing that wasn't good was my cheese curds....they were really greasy.

In a town where museum exhibits are dedicated to cocktail of the same name, this is clearly the bar of record, and sets a high standard for Madisonian drinking.  It lives on prime real estate on Pinckney that's of ample size, but not quite ample enough on weekends.  I live in an area blessed with both a wide beer selection and quality old fashioneds -- though not always of the Wisconsin variety. Here were fifty taps' worth of wisconsin beers, most of them crafty and unheard of out west and all ludicrously cheap.  For sampling I dove in on the $1 samples in 4-beer flights to quickly get the lay of the land.  My favorite menu items were the fried curds (no surprise I imagine; these were fresh and squeaky, with just enough batter to coat. Other establishments often went much further with the breading than needed) I liked the wedge salad -- and the Wisconsin variation that places french dressing on wedges -- but my favorite salad was the  #20(blue cheese, cherries, almonds; perfectly complementary).   For mains I stuck with sandwiches, pulled pork and later the turkey, both on the large side with the big flavor needed for alcohol offset.
As awesome as you can imagine. I had a hard time deciding between all the amazing restaurants in downtown and so happy I choose this place.
The fish fry and clam chowder are to die for.   Think of it is a old classic supper club in Upstate Wisconsin mixed in with pure urban flair.

The cheese curds were great but man cannot live on cheese curds alone. Not sure why this restaurant is so well rated.. The atmosphere is noisy and the food is pretty bland. Considering Madison is a food mecca I would skip Old Fashioned and venture to one of the many other culinary delight destinations Madison has to offer. That's truly all I have to say about this mediocre restaurant...

Cheese Curds was at the top of my list while visiting Madison, so when I searched them out on Yelp I came across The Old Fashioned and I am glad that I did. It was so good that I had to make a second visit on my short trip to town.  I first arrived for a late lunch with another co-worker, we were promptly seated and the friendly waitress took our orders. We both ordered burgers with a side of cheese curds. For my burger, I went with The Old Fashioned House Burger which was served with hickory-smoked bacon, Cheddar, garlic sauce and a soft-cooked egg all on top of a delicious buttered and toasted roll. Everything about this burger was a hit, the egg, the cheese and garlic sauce all come together for an amazing taste. However I have to admit that the burger took a backseat to the cheese curds, which were clearly made in house. After trying the cheese curds at another place in town, I quickly realized that The Old Fashioned has the best!  I returned to The Old Fashioned again one evening after dinner at a local brew pub, the food was good however the cheese curds were lacking and I needed another fix before leaving Madison so it was back to the Old Fashioned for a side of cheese curds and a beer. There are nearly 150 Wisconsin beers available here to, so that makes a stop at The Old Fashioned a must on any visit!

The name drew me in, and much like a beautiful Madison hooker, the rest kept me happy and wanting more.    There isn't many things more satisfying than a beautifully made Old Fashioned.  These guys do it right.  Each ingredient added separately and muddled with a real muddler and that all important elbow grease.  They could've easily faked it and had mixes ready to add to the alcohol but that didn't happen.  Bartenders were extremely friendly and even more knowledgeable about the drinks.  Great recommendations.  They didn't make anybody feel stupid for not knowing much about the drinks.    They have the standards made with Brandy or Whiskey, but they really shine when they put a little twist on the original.  My favorites involved that awesome Door County cherry juice.  I had 4 drinks, 2 standards, 2 kicked up versions.  All just perfect.  We only had drinks our first night, but heard good things about breakfast so we came back in the morning.  Goddamn gorgeous breakfast.  Biscuits and gravy were one of the best I've had.  Pancakes excellent.  But do yourself a favor and add on the fried potatoes to whatever you order.  Crispy and tasty as hell.  And because it's the law in Wisconsin, I had a Bloody Mary to wash down my breakfast.  They really know how to make a good Bloody.   Ambiance is tear jerker worthy.  Deep, rich, well worn woodwork.  The bar is beautiful.  The decorations and old beer advertising that adorn the barback add so much to the look.    I don't get to Madison very often, but this is gonna be my first and last stop when I do.

Really flavorful and super rich. The cheese curds are the best I have had in Madison so far and the burgers are on par with any other joint in town. I would definitely go back again. The only draw back as with all the restaurants on the square is parking.

The cheese curds here might be the best thing I've ever eaten. They're absolutely perfect and they are just far beyond words. Perfectly crispy, great batter and they just ooze with cheese. I had a burger too but that is off topic. Again, these cheese curds were perfect and I had them with a little bit of horseradish as my dipping sauce. I can honestly talk about these fried cheese ball all day long but they're making me hungry so I'll end my fried cheese rant. The service was great as well!

Well that's just about the best experience anyone could ever have anywhere... ever.  As you can see from my picture, I got the No. 30 with cheese curds, and it was one of the better burgers I've ever eaten. The description of it isn't especially innovative, legendary, or "YOU-CAN-ONLY-GET-IT-HERE", but it tasted absolutely awesome... I don't even know what else to say. The best part about it had to be the bacon. I don't know if they smoke it themselves or where they get it from, but it was some of the most flavorful bacon I've ever had. As a side, I got the cheese curds, and I thought they were also very good. You kind of sort of can't go to Wisconsin without having cheese curds, soooo yeah. Cheese curds can sometimes be bland, but these ones are just artery clogging deliciousness. Please, don't waste your time dipping them in ketchup... they don't deserve that sacrilege.  The beer selection at The Old Fashioned is also insane with I forget how many dozens of taps, as well as an extensive bottled list. Considering I came in a little before 11am, I didn't find it very appropriate to order a beer. Of course, there were plenty of Mimosas and Bloody Mary's being ordered around the place. The prices for these seemed a little high, but it didn't stop them from being ordered at seemingly every other table. What else is there to do in Madison but drink, though? Alright, that was uncalled for.  No complaints from me... everything was perfectly good and perfect. The place was busy, but we didn't have to wait, there was a nice aesthetic, and the food came out surprisingly quickly. I haven't been to any other restaurants in Madison, but good luck in finding a place that'd be more appealing than The Old Fashioned.
First time visit, great food and service! I had the old fashioned burger it was excellent and so were the home made chip. I recommend checking it out!!

Great service. Ordered a diet coke and the fried cheese curds with the tiger blue sauce and the garlic sauce. The soda was flat but they fixed it and have me another. The cheese curds were great. The to,get blue sauce it's a horseradish sauce with blue cheese, very good. The garlic sauce could definitely be more garlicky in my opinion. I would have liked to see more dipping sauce choices for sure...bacon flavored, maybe an avocado based sauce...etc

My girlfriends brother wanted to try this restaurant he said it came highly recommended via his coach. The location is perfect pleasantly placed next to the State Building and has plenty to do around it with the amount of museums around.   As we walked it and I looked around I found the atmosphere to be very rustic and quite pleasant. I was greeted by the smells of dried/cured meats which I find super amazing. We were shown to our seats and created with water promptly which was amazing due to the heat out side. Shortly after sitting we bombarded the poor waiter with questions, being from out of area we hand an exuberant amount of the. The waiter was amazing friendly and quick to answer all the questions asked with out missing a beat. As he explains the different way of ordering food I found the beer list. This is where my jaw hit the ground. With a man like Old Fashioned I expected cocktails and variations of whiskey drinks however the craft beer list was outstanding. As I am a beer geek I was very pleased. The tap list seemed to be larger than 40 with what looked to be followed by another 40+ bottle list. Varieties were outstanding and Brewer selection was even more spectacular.   I zeroed in on the beer in which my pallet desired and shifted my eager eye balls to the food menu I was not alone as all of us were surprised by the complex flavor this short menu offered. Offering combinations of cheeses on a single grilled sandwich with bacon and red peppers (this being their grilled cheese), a burger with a soft fried egg, pulled port ok Texas toast and a few amazing sauces to accompany the most amazing cheese curds my young taste buds have ever wrestled.  All in all I as was everyone in my group today very impressed with the Old Fashioned and give a huge thumbs up and a huge thanks to the staff. Well done and bravo. Now go and enjoy this establishment now!!!
Cheese Curds, Brats and Beer!!! Hell yeah and all for a very reasonable price. I don't live in Madison, so I don't know the nuances of cheese curds and brats but damn this place was good!

Definitely a Madison institution, but so overrated!   The wait is always ridiculous, and you can't make reservations. They have a ton of space, so I don't get why the wait is so long (minimum wait is 1hr regardless of when you go or how small your group is). It must be a scheme to make you so hungry that you over-order and give them more money or spend your wait at the bar drinking more than you would have, also giving them more money.  Yes, they have a great beer selection, and the food is very Wisconsin. Honestly, though, the food doesn't blow me away, and I can go elsewhere for good beer without waiting forever.   The space is nice, but very loud and always crowded.

I LOVED this place and I'm not even a huge beer drinking fan.  The first person I thought of while I perused the beer list was my boyfriend... he loves trying new beers, especially ones that are unique to a particular state/region, and The Old Fashioned has a HUGE beer selection all from Wisconsin (as well as a full bar).  Totally impressed.  The crowd was mixed (which I like), the ambience was festive, and the decor was cool. If I am ever back in Madison, I shall return.

Why have I never reviewed this gem? Well, it's about time! The food is fantastic, atmosphere even better, and a mostly friendly staff.  The fried curds are the best in town. Any burger is fantastic! I'm not sure where you could go wrong other than long wait times, which is well worth it given the high-quality food and service.  My favorite in Madison by a long way!

We love their burgers and salads!  Our waitress was a bit rude to begin with, then she actually apologized and said she was sorry if she was short with us because they were very busy and short-handed.  We were impressed by that.  She was a sweetheart after we talked about it.  We get that.  Fun atmosphere, too!  We'll go back (AND, we want that same waitress again as she did a phenomenal job of taking care of us).  It's a great place!

The Old Fashioned boasts itself as the restaurant "where Wisconsin is king" - in apt description, if you ask me. Every square inch of the establishment is oozing with Midwestern charm. Incandescent lighting gently illuminates the wooden-paneled walls, highlighting tin Blatz signs and framed historic photographs. The atmosphere is both wonderfully intoxicating and oddly nostalgic. You'll swear you've been there before, even upon your very first visit.

Met up with an old friend from HS at The Old Fashioned on a Tuesday evening. We didn't have to wait for a table even though the place seemed pretty packed. We ordered Cheese Curds (my first time having them) and they were pretty decent. I also had the spicy burger without the bun, of course, it was great! The burger patty was cooked to perfection and the balsamic vinaigrette side salad was delicious as well.   I would definitely return .

Stopped here for dinner on my hubby's business trip. We waited for 45 min for our seat, but it was well worth it! Mondays they have bogo free burger night, so that's what we did. Also tried both soups, he beer cheese and the creamy tomato. The beer cheese was a bit rich for our liking, but the tomato was to DIE for!!  I could have had a few extra bowls! Overall a great place. The only down side was the volume level! Very noisy and not a quiet booth to sneak off too.

Do you want to be surrounded by tourists whose hotel told them that this is the place for a "real Wisconsin experience"? Are you in the mood for a sandwich since there are startlingly few non-sandwich items on the menu? Then the Old Fashioned is just the place for you.   This is very much a beer and sandwich place. There are a grand total of THREE non-sandwich entrees on the entire menu: steak, mac n cheese, and trout. That's it. Four if you include the rotating nightly special. Everything else is sandwiches and some salads thrown in for good measure.    You can get good beer and cheese curds anywhere in this town. Sure, the sandwiches here are pretty good. But there's more to comfort food than Schlitz beer signs on the wall, and a bunch of freaking sandwiches.

As the 744th reviewer of this place I doubt there is much I can add. I will just say this: the old fashioneds are only $6.50! Holy cheap! Even if you upgrade to a sphere ice cube for $1.50 that's one helluva deal.

We came here for lunch after visiting the university. The menu immediately cozied up to me with its eight choices of old fashions and burgers.   We ordered the cheese curds as an appetizer while we perused the menu, and they set the bar high for the rest of the meal. We all agreed they were probably the best we'd ever had!  I ordered the Applejack Old Fashioned, which was probably in my top three favorite Old Fashions I've ever tried, and I'm pretty picky when it comes to that cocktail, and I'm always on the hunt for the "best" one.   For food, I ordered the Spicy Burger (No. 29) and added a Fried Egg on top because I couldn't decide between No. 29 and No. 30 (The House Special) and this seemed like a good compromise. It was delicious, and probably one of the juiciest burgers I've had in a long time, and not juicy in a gross way.   The only thing that let me down was the fries that came with the burger. They were pretty bland and kind of hard, without being crunchy. They weren't that great. I should've got the cheese curds as the side instead of just the fries. Although my girlfriend got the side salad and that was pretty good too.   The selection of beers should be enough for anyone to be satisfied.
Love going to old fashion for a drink, cheese curds, and their cookies.  I find there food to be average, but the atmosphere makes up for it...just a fun place to go to every few months.

This place is ok. We came here to try the cheese curds, artisanal cheese and Old Fashioned.   The cheese curds were a traditional Wisconsin sharp yellow cheddar curd fried in a beer batter. They cost $7.95 + $0.50 for the tiger bleu dipping sauce. On the upside the cheddar was really good and the dipping sauce was ok. On the downside, it was a little greasy and salty and charging for the dipping sauce was odd. All that said, they were tasty and if I were to eat here, I would order them again. The cheese plate #3 for $12.95 was good and the Old Fashioned drink $6 was ok. Its got a dive sports bar look and feel. Probably a fun college student hangout.  Listed in Drive Across America: https://www.yelp.com/collection/4_4-FCUBHEQBq43u7DXRig

Came here on a Friday night, arriving at 6:30... Had a 30 minute wait as they don't take reservations, which I was prepared for and it gave me prime opportunity to grab a brandy old fashion at the bar and people watch. First, the drink was delicious, nicely muddled with orange and cherry and was only $5.50 (yay Wisconsin). Second, the crowd is a mix of 60% groups of 40 year olds, 30% groups of young professionals and 10% college students in sweat pants.   We ordered a lazy Susan appetizer which had great variety, a cornucopia of Wisconsin delights, very reasonably priced and worth savoring. Dinner was the fried walleye, which was light and flaky, with an expert amount of breading to not over power such a delicious fish.   The waitstaff is very, very busy so don't expect to make any BFF's or hear more than the regimental specials of the day.   Overall, great place for a Friday fish fry with good friends who don't mind sharing bites and leaning in to hear the conversation.

The food is good for visiting relatives and out of towners. Mostly its just decent greasy spoon food with nothing horrible but also not stellar. It is a good place for drinks though as they offer a large beer selection and are right off the square.

Oh CHEESE CURDS, CHEESE CURDS AND CHEESE CURDS...  Wisconsin, the state known for its great cheese! You cant leave this state without cheese curds from The Old Fashioned. Its almost given that this restaurant is known for the BEST cheese curds in Madison, WI. Yes, I know there are so many other restaurants that have cheese curds on their menu but this place is probably the best you can get in Madison!  I have visited Madison twice in the last 4 months and I think I came here twice just to eat their cheese curds. Their cheese curds are very soft and it melts in your mouth perfectly! With a glass of COLD BEER of your choice, its the best way to end your day after work.  They have an extensive menu for lunch and dinner too and supposedly, their gourmet burgers are very tasty as well. I forgot which one but my boyfriend and I tried 2 different burgers and they were both very fulfilling and mouthwatering.  Customer service was superb and I really have nothing to complain about their food and service. The restaurant itself is very clean and neatly organized. Only downside about this place is parking. They do not have private parking lot so street parking or public parking is best bet.  But anyway, if you are visiting Madison and/or you love fried cheese, please come by The Old Fashioned and try their infamous Cheese Curds! There's usually a long wait for dinner but seats at the bar are available without any wait upon availability!

People love this place, but every time I am dragged there I continue to wonder why.  Bar service is lukewarm.  Table service is lukewarm.  The atmosphere is honestly nothing special.  The Wisconsin beer list is fine but they always seem to be out of something on the list.  And the food is simply not that good.  I haven't had the cheese curds, but their sandwiches skimp on the meat and the bread isn't all that enjoyable.  Three stars for location and the Wisconsin character; they just don't pull it off that well.

Let me get this out of the way: I feel like "not a true Madisonian" because I only find The Old Fashioned to be good, not great. This is where a lot of people take visitors for the "Madison" experience but ultimately as good as they are (and they're a bit of alright) ... I can't get past the noise level.  When I go out to eat I want to be able to talk to the people I am out with. If you get into The Old Fashioned after 5pm -- you can kiss that goodbye.  The way the restaurant is arranged it can be a gauntlet navigating through it as well (my sympathies to the wait staff, who are excellent by the way).  Their food is always good, but nothing else really stands out to me. I tend to go for burgers here and so perhaps that is partially on me.  The big pro, for me, is definitely the cheese curds. The breading is my ideal for what I want cheese curd breading to be. The curds are always flavorful (as opposed to just a wad of gooey salt, or obviously from frozen which is what you experience in many places)... and for this reason alone I will probably still keep coming back once in a rarity.  When I do come back, however, it will be early enough so that I can still hear the raving of my friends about how amazing the curds are.
Their cheese curds, & beer cheese soup are superior! My favorite restaurant on the square. Friendly staff and quick service. The old fationed never fails to impress me and my friends.

food is delicious, especially the cheese curds. not sure i am a fan of the up charge for the tiger sauce. also asked the bar keep to put ESPN on, but instead he left casino royale (which was muted of course) on

One of the greatest meals I've ever eaten. Excellent service and wonderful ambience. Highly recommend. We had the wedge salad, prime rib salad and cheese curds. Everything was like the best comfort food - perfectly rich and not gross, know what I mean?
